text: My wife and I spent the last two weeks of January here. The hotel is very nice, clean and the staff are attentive and helpful. The food in the buffet restaurant was OK.... nothing too special, but they try to cater for all tastes. We booked B&B only as we prefer not to be 'tied' to the same place for meals. However, outside the hotel, there is little choice along the beach. Only the 'sunshine bar' at the far Right as you look at the sea. The food there is simple, but very good and very reasonable. We eat at the 'Mustard' restaurant as well as the 'Fine Dining' restaurant that is within the hotel grounds. The food at both was very good, but because most of the guests were 'All Inclusive' and eat at the buffet, we dined alone in the other restaurants. I did have a bit of an issue with one of the 'room boys' though. The one we had at the start of our holiday was very attentive and made sure he told us each day that 'he was our room boy' (obviously after a tip at the end of the holiday). But he disappeared halfway through our time there. So, when we finally came to pack our bags, we gave our tip to the room boy that took over. However, as we walked with our cases to the lift, we were approached by the original room boy who made it obvious that he wanted a tip also. But we had already given our last Rupees away, so had nothing left. It was a cringingly embarrassing moment, which I didn't feel we should have been put in. I've seen comments here about the 'beach sellers' ... Our experience was nothing but good. I got friendly with a middle aged man called Pathmi, (usually wears a Red baseball cap and carries a Red Sri-Lanka tourism bag) He took me and his Nephew on a fishing trip in the mangroves. It was great. He also invited me back to his house, where his wife had cooked a 1.5kilo fish, potatoes, rice and curry sauce for lunch.... It was a real honour to go into his house as well as humbling..... So please look out for him on the beach. He's a real 'find'! If you are looking for a hotel that can provide good, clean accommodation, as well as good food and are happy to more or less stay around the hotel/beach area... this is a great place! If you are looking for a hotel, but would like to walk along the beach to find different restaurants, then look again. There's none there! (apart from 1)

text: We stayed in Heritance Ahungalla for 16 nights. I want to structure the Review in positive, neutral and negative things and because everyone seems to tell just the positive things i start with the negative ones. Negative: - Dirty beach; the Hotel does not care about the litter on the beach. Of course it is a public beach but there are only Hotel guests. Thats why they should clean it more often. - Beach Boys: they wait in front of the beach and even whistle or shout for someone. You always feel observed when you lie on the pool - Rooms are in poor condition. In the shower is mould, the curtains are dirty and the furniture is old (i enclosed some Pictures). This is definitely not 5-star-hotel-like! - The Hotel customer Service asked if we could give them a good tripadvisor-rating and they want to see if you give 5 points. Thats certainly the fact why there are so many good Reviews. - The Prices in the Hotel (if you dont have AI) are quite high. A 0,3 Liter Diet-Coke is about 3 Dollar, the dinner 26 Dollar. Very much for a Country like Sri Lanka. - When you leave the Hotel there are some Tuk-Tuk-Driver who want to bring you to the next herbal-farm or wants to sell you drugs. After our second try, we did not dare to go out -The Bar staff was quite slow and we had to wait almost 15 minutes till someone cared. That happened many times. Neutral: - Loud Room: We had a room over the bar and the bass was quite loud till 11 p.m. But most other rooms which are further away are certainly quiet. When we told this to the front desk they immediately offered another room Positive: - The architecture of the Hotel and the beautiful pools. - The Housekeeping and almost every Hotel employee was extremely friendly - The animals in the Hotel. There where cute chipmunks, funny apes, lovely ravens taking their bath in the pool, a lizard and even a big snake (i dont know if it was poisonous) - great Food. I dont think that you can find any better Food in Sri Lanka I just rate the Hotel with two out of five because it is made much better on tripadivor than it is for real. In my opinion it is not better than a european 3-Star-Hotel and i know that sri-lanka-standard is far lower than european but unfortunately the Prices are not like Sri Lanka (Massage 1 hour- 100 Dollar!)

text: This is by far my most favorite hotel in Sri Lanka... It's luxury and comfort with the welcoming and relaxing feeling of being right at home.. The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating and went out of there way to tend to our every need.. Exceptional service which I have never experienced anywhere.. The food was fantastic.. The rooms were beautifully decorated, very comfortable and well thought of with all the amenities you would need.. They even helped us make baby food for my little niece.. And the views were simply breathtaking.. I can't wait to go back again to this amazing place with warm smiles, amazing food, beautiful architecture and most importantly the relaxed, peaceful and calm surroundings.. Absolutely loved it!!!

text: Have just returned from a two week trip to Sri Lanka (Nov04) where we based ourselves at the Triton Hotel, Ahungalla. I must say although the hotel needs a overhaul ( due to be completed from May05toNov05) we had a wonderfull stay there. The food was excellant at all times. The initial room was also lovely but upon discovery of a small leak we were instantly upgraded to a suite with no questions asked by the hotel. What seemed to set the hotel apart was simply its level of service. All employees from maintenance to guest relations were excellent and couldnt do enough to help. Weddings were also a source of pleasure as the hotel puts a real show on with the dancers, elephant and evening fireworks. The only downside was the beach sellers who are quite persistent and initially put you off visiting the beach. However after a few days they recognise and it becomes far less a hassle. Altogether a lovely hotel experience for the price.

text: The hotel lobby sets the scene for the hotel itself â€“ a lobby spreading out into the infinity pool, that leads into the beach and sea. The staff provide a humbling and warm welcome, showcasing their hospitable nature from the moment you step inside. The pool is idyllic and the food showcases the talents of the award-winning kitchen. We were lucky to meet Celebrity Chef and 15 time Gold Olympic Medallist Dimuthu Kumarasinghe, and all I can say is that I am surprised he has not appeared on all our TV screens! A true culinary talent, and the most humble person, he has led an equally talent set of kitchen employees to create some truly wonderful culinary experiences. Thank you to Heshan and Kevin for giving us the best kitchen tour and pastry session, and Dinushan for providing a stellar hotel tour! All in all, this hotel is a must if you are visiting Ahungalla.

text: We arrived at the hotel after almost 20 hours by plane and found out that espresso coffee is a special coffee and will have to pay, although it has the same taste and in no case was an espresso. I mention that we had an all-inclusive supplement and the coffee was included First Breakfast: i wanted an omelette I asked the chef to prepare "well done", but he became visibly irritated because I have explained in more detail. He said something in his language, evading after I asked him what he said. I inspected the room where I was staying and found that under the bed were traces of visible dust probably old before those who have been staying here previously, the bathroom is not the bathroom of a 5stars hotel. The towels are to used and have old stains. On the ceiling we discovered traces of mosquito / dead flies on the ceiling of the bathroom The beach behind the hotel filled with annoying vendors that are allowed by the security agents even inside of the hotel property limit. We found the waiters mostly unprepared, lazy and disinterested. At the pool if you order a drink lasts an eternity. In fact, if you order anything in this hotel last an eternity. The food at dinner buffet is an ordinary cantine and you can easily see that they recycle the food from evening to another or is the same food. The concept of all inclusive is a joke, because there are only a few types of local drinks and those bad. Beach towels are to used and have old stains. We chose the restaurant "fine dining", but the disappointment continued. We first drink comes after 15 minutes, and the food was brought after an hour of waiting and although you must have 15 / discount due prepaid package of all inclusive, we were charged 100 / requires that the next day to ask for explanations, explanations that reduced bill. However, the food is typical of a normal restaurant. Not bad, but nothing special. I have to mention that in the fine dining restaurant were only 2 tables with people. It was empty! The new years evening was ok, but we wanted to order champagne and they told us they are out of stock. We wanted Moet, they gave us Mumm. How can you not have stocks of champagne for New Years Eve? The food was very good. If this have been the food for all the holiday i could have forgot all the other things At 14.30 in the nect day the room was not cleaned in the context in which We left at 9 am the room. I ordered a soft drink included in all-inclusive package, it was added to the bill and replaced at the my request. Conclusion: if you're not careful pay twice. Wishing to relax at the beach we waited 30 minutes for the staff to find sun beds towels. Another breakfast: I asked two omelets ( for me and my husband) everything OK, I asked him and the third omelets for my son and the cook was getting nervous. The adventure continues... For sure the hotel management will have a respond to this post, but it will not make any difference , because my new years eve holiday was ruined, so I recommend you avoid this hotel that can be classified as no more than one 4-star hotel!

text: We were in rooms 209 and 210. Pros: - well laid out and planned hotel - swimming pool area is beautiful - proximity to beach lovely Cons: - hardly any lights in room-very dim - run down - wifi not too great - very sparse room-not even a coffee table! - kettle had a calcified or corroded heating element so we did not want to take a chance with boiling water for our morning coffee. While it was well camouflaged, there was no plug point attached to the kettle so it would had to be physically moved near a plug point to operate-bad design. - bathroom has windows with only dusty, uneven Venetian blinds for so-called privacy - floor was dirty with dirt stuck on it - room was smelling musty when we came in. Couldn't leave balcony door open for too long to air, due to mosquitoes. - no room numbers written on key card envelopes-had to go out the door to check! - no in-hotel numbers written near the phone - cobwebs on balcony panels-rubber coming off - hotel information papers in the binder were not in order-pages missing. - no in-room menu in room. - checking in took time and we were shown a seating area that was impractical to sit in as sofas were not placed opposite of each other but next to each other. We stood around for about 10-15 mins and no one even asked us to take a seat at another more practical area which was close by. - the man showed us everything in the room but to omitted to show us the balcony! We could not see it as it had opaque sliding type panels that covered the sliding windows - the towels and sheets did not smell fresh - hardly any vegetarian options in the menu to warrant the money so the only options were a la carte in the coffee shop and that were going to take 45 mins to order. That hardly seems fair for vegetarians, does it? Since there was no other option, we ordered 3 western choices from this menu. Unfortunately, we were disappointed with the quality and taste of all the options. The veg lasagne had pasta that was chewy, the pasta primavera had peas that were raw and the potato and bean 'pie' was in fact not a pie at all-just potatoes, onions and beans topped with cheese! - The place needs a lot of maintenance.which it wasn't getting - staff need to improve their English, esp since there are so many non srilankans visiting-language was definitely a barrier esp when it came to ordering food. - staff need to be better trained to know what the hotel offers-boy who showed us to rooms said we could get a la carte in the dining hall. Instead there was only a buffet and no a la carte. - in our room, 210, we had no locking system in the door inside the room-no latch or knob, so ostensibly, the master key could be used to open the door at any time from the outside, even while we are inside the room - no tissues in tissue box in room 209-poor housekeeping - took 20 mins and reminding a few times to get our coffee at breakfast - took a long time for the dirty plates piled up from the buffet breakfast to be cleared. Had to point it out. Sadly, the cons far outweighed the pros. I would not stay here again unless it undergoes a major restructuring.

text: We hosted an International Conference on Assisted Reproductive Technologies for a group of 90 doctors from around the world. We have been hosting such meetings annually in destinations like Nepal, Goa, Khajuraho, Seychelles, Singapore & more. This was one of our best experiences with a Hotel that taught us what Sri Lankan hospitality is all about. The front office staff, the back-end staff, the F & B staff and the event management team were all excellent and helpful and set new bench-marks fro us for future meetings. The property is visually stunning and the open lobby takes your breath away with the majestic ocean view on entering the Hotel. Attention to small details like the design of the trolley that brings welcome drinks to a guest checking in and the smiling faces of the front desk staff go a long way in first impressions. Although the property is 35 years old, it is very well maintained with huge trees planted in the stair-wells. The architecture and design and the room interiors all blend for an exotic asian experience. The meals are wonderful, the four bars in the hotel are superlative and the three swimming pools take your breath away. The conference was running two halls simultaneously and the meeting went off without a glitch. Three nights we had music concerts in the main hall and cocktails being served. This was a global gathering and the unanimous opinion was "this was one of the best experiences we have had!" Since I was the President of the meeting, I did not have time to relax and want to go back for a short break only to take in the same sights and smells again. This was like Heaven.

text: We stayed at the Heritance Kandalama and were expecting the same high standard we had there. Unfortuantely we were very dissapointed by the Ahungalla. How this hotel managed to win an award I will never know! The hotel is dirty and tired and the service at breakfast is worth a special mention for all the wrong reasons. Dirty tables left uncleared for hours, the most disgusting tea and coffee I have ever tasted in my entire life and service without a smile. The only thing positive I have to say about the hotel is its location and the morning walk you can take along the stretch of beach on your door step. However, a word of warning, there are beach sellers who try to befriend (hassle) you about every 20 mins so go for your walk early before they get up!! All I can say is thank goodness we didnt spend our entire stay here!

text: Pros- Relaxed beach location with spacious rooms. Good choice of bars and restaurants. Excellent breakfast buffet. Friendly staff, especially in the restaurants and around the pool. Very nice, big pools. Lots of interesting wildlife. Laundry service was excellent and good value. Cons- There were some hawkers on the property around the pool area selling sarongs and tours. An annoyance when trying to relax. The air con in our room was not very effective. By contrast it was excellent in our kids room. There was black mold in the shower. When it rains, the communal corridors are prone to flooding. The room attendants are very pushy about tips. Our attendant Ranil visited our room a day before we left to tell us he wouldnâ€™t be there the following day. We tipped him well, but the next day, the day of our checkout, a new room attendant who we didnâ€™t know came into the room twice on the pretext of checking the minibar and hung around clearly also expecting to be tipped. We are always happy to tip for service, but this pushy experience made us quite uncomfortable and left a bad final impression of our stay. The day before leaving we asked for a late checkout on one of our two rooms and were told that would be possible for an extra $50 US. We happily agreed to this, but the following morning we were told neither room was available. This seems unlikely as the hotel was not at all busy (it was five days after the terrorist attacks). So we had a few hours hanging around the hot hotel common areas before our airport pickup. Not the best way to end what was otherwise a very enjoyable and relaxed stay.

text: We stayed at Heritance Ahungalla for the second time and again enjoyed the splendid architecture, the beautiful location, the excellent food and - about of all - the friendliness of the staff. text: Having returned on 11th June after 12 nights at this hotel on vacation with my wife, I feel the need to express my gratitude for such an amazing holiday. My wife and I were married in Sri Lanka last year and we fell in love with Sri Lanka - we felt compelled to return to celebrate our 1st anniversary (but this time at a different hotel). As soon as we arrived - the first impressions were..........wow. The brochures do not do this stunning hotel justice. Having had a long tiring journey, we were given a very warm welcome. We stayed in a Suite which was superb in every way. The rooms are serviced daily by friendly housekeeping staff to a very very high standard. I am a Executive Chef who is in charge of a group of Companies providing Fine Dining Catering with bespoke menu's to wealthy clientele, so I was intrigued to find out whether this 5* hotel would impress. I need not have questioned this thought. After talking to The Food and Beverage Manager, I was invited to look around the kitchens and meet their brigade. The kitchens were immaculate, staff spotless, motivated and relaxed in their work - delivering the most delicious fine dining experience. With Sri Lanka's top medal winning Chef at the helm this comes as no surprise. If it is fantastic food and excellent service you require, then look no further. We will definitely return.

text: I was a part of a team coordinating a wedding to be held at Heritance Ahungalle on Saturday 20th Dec. All plans were in place and all of us in the coordinating team were moving ahead with the game plan when we got to know that the furniture supplier had messed up the order. Needless to say that all hell broke loose while we tried to work out an alternate solution, it was a mere 3 hours before the wedding ceremony. A lot of stress, tension and heart stopping moments later the furniture arrived at 3.00 pm, we had to set up and decorate 30 tables in 1 1/2 hours - guest were due to arrive at 4.30 pm. The team at Heritance Ahungalle, stepped up to the occasion, they deployed additional crew to unload and set up furniture and get it all going to ensure that the wedding set up was ready on time. Their attitude was fantastic - it was a case of everyone working together to give the couple a wedding to remember. The result was fantastic, everything was set up and ready for the wedding with mere moments to spare and it all looked brilliant. It was a result of brilliant cooperation, understanding and adrenaline. No one entering that marquee would have realised the tension we all had to work through - the set up looked stunning and the couple said that it was more than what they expected. What's important is that it was not the responsibility of the hotel to do all this and we in the coordinating crew know that if not for the team at Heritance Ahungalle lead by their F&B Manager Gamini we would not have been to get it all together on time for our clients and give them the wedding of their life. Thank you so much! I have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to anyone.

text: This is our third trip to heritance ahungalla and had a really poor customer service. This not what we are expecting after paying Rs 3500 per adult. we will never come back to this place.

text: I had read so many great reviews about this hotel and was really looking forward to staying here, and I somehow feel like I have stayed on another planet compared to the other people who reviewed here. I will comment that the Chef Sarun was fantastic and made the best meal we had in Sri Lanka, the gentleman who was serving us was very good. Now, the hotel is getting very tired and could use a renovation, I was first taken to a room with 2 single beds, being a couple this wasn't good enough, but also laying on the bed it was comfy, the second room had a double bed but was uncomfortable, so we left it to the young man who took us to the room to try and sort out something else - either putting blankets under or a pillow top, anything, we gave them 2hrs and nothing happened. I went to reception, spoke with the executive gentleman, who apologized and said we could look at other rooms, apparently they only have 1 type of mattress which I don't believe. In the meantime I had ordered food from the restaurant and was told it would still be another 15mins away, we proceeded to the next room, same, next room same, so I said I would settle just for the twin singles as we were only staying one night. He then said he would get a new room sorted out and have our luggage moved. When I got back, my food was waiting and it was cold, less than 15mins. I advised the waiter and he said thanks- what for ????? We waited 1hr for no key, went to reception and collected our new room key. Went to the room, located at the end of the hotel, and our luggage was not there yet. Next thing I'm looking at the table and there is ANTS EVERYWHERE, now I'm talking about 1000+ all having a little party on the ground and under the table, walking down the walls etc. I have plenty of photos which I will put up when I have better Internet at home. I rang front desk and we got moved again 2 doors down, we went for a swim for 1hr again, come back and there was more ANTS in the room. We didn't get offered another room, but got dinner which is the only reason this gets a 2 star and not 1. We didn't sleep very well and the band / music was playing very loud well into the night. We had to check out at 7am, I had ordered a breakfast, but when I went to check out, I was hauled to the cashier office, and they kept me there for 10mins arguing about the meal from the afternoon which was cold and I was told would be taken off the room, and, they also tried to charge me for a phone call from my room, which was the executive ringing the manager about the ANTS. The lady who apparently was guest relations needs to be sacked, the cashier needs to be sacked for trying to rip me off. This left the worst taste in my opinion of Sri Lanka and I cannot believe this hotels staff would act like this to customers. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, hopefully management looks at this and takes action.

text: I'm from Kandy. We (myself and my wife) went to Kandalama in dabulla and had a great time So we wanted to take our parents as well. It's pointless of going to the same place (Kandalama) twice therefore we decided to go to ahungama heritance since it's all from the same family. There's about 220km from kandy (up and down both about 450-500Km) it was along trip. by the time we got to the hotel it was 5.00pm on 05/12/2015. We told the reception we have 2 bookings, one double room and one triple room. The welcoming lady was a fat girl and she was very rude to us she did not support at all even when filling the forms during the check in. and she took us to our rooms Double room (215)was ok but the triple room was very small (216) and fully packed most of all there were only 2 beds, so when i inquire about the 3rd bed from that girl we said " Ah.... ok i will send a folding bed for you" As if like we are servants/slaves. I told her politely. I request for a triple room and I have already done the payment by visiting to your headoffice at aitken spence colombo. Her reply was "all our rooms are this size there is nothing we can do" I said if you put another folding bed here, there is no space even to walk in this room. Her reply was "Sorry" she said it in a way either you take the room or go home, and she went away saying she will send someone with the folding bed. My mother said "don't be mad putha we all came here to enjoy not to fight the other room(215) seems to be a bit large so we shifted to the next room. Then again I thought I already paid for a triple room and I don't get the service I wanted. If the hotel has only double rooms, they should have told me when booking. they never told me that. I got mad. I called the reception and requested to connect with the manager. Unfortunately manager was not there and an executive officer was available named "Chathuranga" I told him about my situation. I have child about 10 months old. Myself mywife my child and my mother all are staying at this room, and the room is too small. he quietly listened to my situation and he asked me 5 mins and call back. then he called me and say "sir we have a large room vacant you can shift to that room" I was delighted we all went there to enjoy not to suffer and stay in a room like in a prison cell. Then again I called to chathuranga and appologised him for getting mad and raising my voice what he told me shocking. he told me "sir it's better you told me now rather than checking out, if so we couldn't have done anything for you.

text: This hotel is one of the nicest hotels I've ever been. The personnel and staff is extremely friendly and helps whenever they can. The food is mainly local, some people hate it, others love it, but if you hate it, no problem, at the pool bar you can get burgers and fries. Room was very nice and clean, fresh towels 2 times a day and they even have a night service to open your bedsheets. Positive Points: - Friendly Staff - Nice local food - All inclusive formula is nearly perfect (will come back later to this) - Nice views of the pool - Nice, clean and big rooms - Wifi EVERYWHERE Negative Points: - All inclusive doesn't include "light" drinks, so as a person with Sugar disease you can not take Cola Light but only regular Cola. This is something where they should look for an alternative for people who can not have that much sugar and don't like water. - The people at the beach who try to sell you stuff, they are nice and friendly, but if you are friendly back and buy some stuff, they just keep coming asking for more, asking for drinks, milkshakes,... This is something to watch. Overall it's a very nice hotel and I will definitely come back to this one.

text: 4 of us stayed here from the 7th to the 18th of January. We had originally booked the Turyya Hotel , also 5 STAR , but had a call from our tour operator MERCURY to see if we wanted to change to the Heritance because the Turyya had been downgraded to a 4 Star Hotel due to a lot of complaints. We were happy to book into the Heritance . But did not have the good experience that we had expected. Our rooms were quite dirty . So much so that my daughter cleaned her room with a packet of Babywipes. My Husband did some cleaning with a towel . I refused to do so . I do not think that this should be part of my Holiday. Then we checked our pillows and duvet and had a big shock. We took our bedding to the lobby and were quickly ushered in to a back room . After complaining we were offered an , as the Manager called it , an upgraded room. We were taken to have a look at the room and were happy to move in to it . It was actually exactly the same room as the dirty one but newly decorated with a new shower etc. Before we moved in to the new room the manager asked would it be Ok if he would go and check the bedding . Of course we agreed . At around 11 o'clock I heard loud voices from my daughters room . I went to see what was going on and again the bedding was dirty . Duvet cover had a big brown stain on it and one of the pillows had mould all over it. The manager told us " that is why we put 2 pillow cases on it " OH DEAR !!!!!! But after that , I must praise the boys who cleaned our room , everything was spotless. The next day at mealtimes we were surprised that the restaurant staff seemed to be totally confused . It was a bit like FAULY TOWERS . There were other issues but it would take to long to mention them all . Would we come back to this Hotel . absolutely not , never ever .

text: Heritance Ahungalla is a decent hotel with excellent staff. Stayed three nights with family and friends and the staff were always obliging and eager to please. They also work hard. The hotel was busy and it covers a big area and the staff were as busy as bees. But always good to the guests. Where I mark the hotel down is: a) The hotel is dated and looking very tired. I think one wing looked recently renovated, but the wing we stayed in, although clean, looked too tired. It badly needs an upgrade. A '5 star' should not be allowed to deteriorate to this extent before renovation b) It's a large hotel but surprisingly low on activities. As a result there is no 'wow' factor to justify the expensive rates. The beach is nice and it's a long stretch but the hotel is strangely lifeless and boring. As it is I would say this is a '4 star'. We had a nice time but there are so many options in Sri Lanka now and there isn't a good enough reason to return to this hotel.

text: Ahungalla Heritance Hotel is reassuring when you arrive through its private drive after passing the entrance arch gate. It keeps being reassuring when you discover the open reception to the swimming pool that visually extends straight into the Indian Ocean just few meters away until â€¦ you end up checking in at a bar behind the reception that was very dark as most of its lights were switch off; was it a try of being Eco friendly ?? We had a strange feeling that the hotel was not up to its 5*. This obvious detail was like the top of an iceberg; will we discover the rest of it along our stay? Was Heritance a 5* iceberg? The room was ok, yet had aged and would need a lift. There was no safe deposit (5*?). The room maintenance appeared secondary as we noticed an obvious splash of dirt on the terrace door window and one of the door lock was broken. At â€œMustard coffee shopâ€, we ordered seafood salad, it came with no salad or veggies (misleading salad term). We checked the â€œUpperRestaurantâ€ menu and were not impressed by its presentation neither by the incomprehensive culinary composition of its expensive dishes. The restaurant was empty â€¦ lack of soul, poor lighting, no spark. Instead we went to this little Coconut Hut restaurant down the beach out of the hotel, where we really had a superb and reasonable diner, thank you to Berthy the owner for his welcome. We recommend it. Back to our room, we were not blown by the auto glorifying video of Heritance Ahungalla that was played in random on the hotel TV channel, it sounded too superlative to be true. The Heritance corporate management needs to open its eyes, international real 5* hotel are on their way to Sri Lanka and soon they may be at the origin of the end of Heritance Hotels 5 * era. The F & B department should also be worry and revise its restaurants concepts and put its heart and mind into it.

text: We know the hotel as we used to stay there several years in a row some years ago. The architecture is stunning, but some improvements on the rooms are needed to bring it back to 5 star standards. Upon check-in we were early and were told that normal check-in time is 2 pm. We waited for 2 1/2 hours til 2 pm and several inquiries, there we were told, that they are checking. At 2 pm it seems everybody arriving after us was checked-in and we still did not get any information. I went to the reception to complain, but they were busy to set up other guests internet on the phone than to attend to guests who were waiting for 2 1/2 hours. After asking for the manager it suddenly worked and we got a room and apology. Although we asked for the new wing, we were offered a room in the old wing. Despite of kitchen odor this room was definitely the better choice for us as on the other side a 2 day party was going on with lots of noise. Room was ok and had a nice sea view. Cleanliness of the room could have been better. Especially in the shower there were signs of mould and shower door was completely covered with limescale. Service especially upon check-in was definitely not 5 star standard. Also for breakfast it was announced to start at 7 am, but when we came down ones at 7.10 am, nothing was ready, noone was taking note in order to serve coffee or tea. The egg corner was not occupied to order eggs, etc. If 7 am is published for breakfast, it should be ready for service. Food was very good though. Another point to reconsider might be the christmas decoration which did not fit the hotel at all. All in all we had a nice stay in the end. If we would come back, we are not sure as we know better from this hotel from previous stays and it is quite pricy for the service offered.

text: I couldn't agree more with the comments below. We stayed there from 26th December until after New Year. Had we been able to get a refund we would have moved out on day 1! Firstly, despite what their website says, all rooms do NOT have a sea view. We were given a room overlooking the tennis courts. After a huge discussion, they said that we could move to a lower category room - where a seaview was availabile - BUT they wouldn't refund us the Â£450 difference. After I pointed out that they were falsely advertising, the local agent out there agreed to pay for us to upgrade us to a luxury suite - however, the hotel really should have picked up this cost as their website was giving incorrect information! The suite was ok - but not worth the money they charge. Again, their website states luxury goods and free sparkling wine, fruit etc. None of those things materialised! The shower gel was provided in glass bottles which took forever to let the gel out. There was no conditioner, no bubble bath and the cotton buds were only supplied on the first day - all basic things for a 5 star hotel! The lighting is also totally illogical as the person states below. It's certainly not a luxury 5 star property. There's water aerobics in the pool every day - with loud techno music blaring out of the speakers. They had Karaoke in one bar and a very naff electronic keyboard player belting out songs like "lady in red" in the other. Not exclusive property that it claims to be! The sun loungers had dirty cushions - which didn't even cover the whole of the lounger - and there weren't enough for the number of guests. You were also shouted at by the hawkers from the beach - which really shouldn't happen at this type of property (I've stayed at lots in Sri Lanka and nowhere else is like that!) Finally, the food. It was very uninspiring for the cost. The upper restaurant was not open the whole time we were there - so the only a la carte menu available was from the coffee shop. I think it's an absolute disgrace to charge the money they do - I was incredibly misled and I too will be lodging a formal complaint. The only saving grace was the location - but frankly - there are lots of hotels in Sri Lanka with just as nice locations - minus the hawkers and at a much cheaper cost!

text: I live in Dubai, so I know what a USD$400 per night hotel room should get you. Therefore, in Sri Lanka, it should be at least on par - if not a thousand times better. This review comes with a disclaimer â€“ the hotel did compensate me with a rather dramatic discount upon departure. I do not believe that this hotel can realistically charge the amount they do for this level of property and service. In the end I believe we paid a fair amount for what we received. They begged me not to write a bad review, so I will not, but I will state the truth. Letâ€™s start with the â€œprosâ€: - Beautifully designed hotel with authentic colonial architecture. - Lovely view from most of the balconies. - Several dining options available. - Good bathrooms. - Good a/c in rooms. - Massages at the spa are heavenly. Probably the best Iâ€™ve ever had! - Management responded well to our complaints. Now over to the â€œconsâ€: - The â€œconfirmedâ€ airport transfer was not booked. We waited 2 hours at the airport before they finally arranged. - Our room was filthy. Even after complaining it did not improve. - Room service, bar and snack menus are the same. No Sri Lankan food in sight! - Manicure and hair treatments at the spa were disastrous (rough nails and stripped colour from hair). - Dirty linen at all F&B outlets and room service.

text: We finally decided to give this hotel a shot as we were traveling through the area mainly due to its architecture (Jeffrey Bower design) and location. Sadly this place failed us. Trivago lists the room that we were given for around $90 US. We paid $175 per night for the two day stay with the full understanding that we'll be getting a decent room. I was expecting much better accommodations given it's the off season and the hotel in near empty. Firt room we got was so bad that I refused it immediately. They then moved us to a different "deluxe" room, as I was told, which was marginally better than the first one. The bathroom is dirty, no bath robes in the room and the view is sub par. The room is located in the far corner of the hotel. It is a smoking room and we were not offered the option to choose whether we needed a smoking room or not. It's puzzling to me that the hotel staff felt this room is consistent with a 5 star hotel. I'd rate this place and our experience at 3 stars at best! I've given them two opportunities to rectify the situation and they utterly failed both times. They've had a golden opportunity to wow us and grantee a repeat customer but for some reason, that I still can't understand, they chose to make sure that we will not come back again. In this copetitive field, where there are many other options availabe, the accommodation we've received is not what I had expected from a Heritance chain (Kandalama in contrast was fantastic). We'll be in this country 3 more days and was hoping to to spend it in this area had they met our expectations. Instead we'll be moving to the Hilton in Colombo for the remainder of our stay. Needless to say that this is the first and the last time for us in this perticular facility. Situation of this type do not warrant a third chance. To the management team... look very closely into the culture that is set forth. I don't think you can afford to have customers like us, who travel all over the world and are often in Sri Lanka, to be this dissatisfied with your facilities. Every one that complains on a site like this, ten goes without taking the time to do so yet they are just as dissatisfied. You're alianating the very customers that is your life blood. This is an absolute self inflicted wound.

text: We are staying at the Heritance Ahungalla during the monsoon low season, but weather has been great. The hotel is a beautiful Geoffrey Bawa resort, not new but reasonably well maintained. We have a lovely comfortable, well appointed room, spotlessly clean and attended to each day. Beautiful swimming pool (can't swim in the ocean at this time of year as it's too rough). Friendly staff. Great breakfast. So why aren't I giving this resort 5 stars? A few problems. Firstly the service at the outdoor bar area is very slow for simple snacks/ lunch. You wait and wait for a simple sandwich for example. Prices are very high. With tax and service we just paid 2,000 rupee for a bottle of Lion beer, a lime and soda and bowl of devilled cashews. The resort feels a bit isolated and there aren't obvious alternatives for dining etc. (that may explain the high prices.) The resort is large. Next time I will stay in all boutique hotels and guest houses for more personalised service and better value in Sri Lanka. I feel a bit ripped off at this resort (and we have stayed at a range of places around Sri Lanka). Even up market resorts need to understand that there is a limit to what tourists will pay for basics.

text: From the moment we arrived we were greeted with smiles and fantastic service. The level of service throughout the hotel was without exception first class. We stayed in a room overlooking the main swimming pool and also a suite, both of which were lovely. All of our wedding arrangements were taken care of seamlessly, and the whole experience of getting married abroad could not have been smoother. A special thanks has to go to Shanika Jayasekara who co-ordinated our wedding and was there throughout the day making sure everything went to plan. Shanika and Mawatte Mawanna both Executive Officers at the hotel kindly acted as witnesses on the day for which we were both very grateful. On the wedding day we had a tropical storm in the middle of the service, this meant we had to quickly re-locate to a covered area, this was done by many hands in little time, everyone very willing to make the best of the situation. This made a big difference to our day and eventually the sun came back out and we finished the service in the gardens of the hotel. Many thanks for making our wedding unforgettable.

text: we stayed 5 nights up to the 22nd sep in a luxury rated room which I upgraded to for Â£50 per night extra from a deluxe room they wanted Â£61 but a deal was done ,the room was fine good size .ac did not regulate cold or cold. in general hotel is very tired and needs a refurb,looking shabby the public areas in particular,chairs and tables in bars and restaurants are sticky thru not being cleaned properly. only really one main bar area next to main pool and reception this is completetely devoid of ambience and comforts hardly a good advert for checking in guests who are brought here. the a la carte restaurant next to the main dining room while serving reasonable food is dirty with table runners stained and dirty when restaurant manager challenged about theis he quickly had it changed the same night our food came out cold ,not good for curries!the meal was remade but it was too late the damage done,they tried to make amends with a free dessert please too little too late. the main dining room is where we took breakfast and on one occasion a buffet dinner,the tables and chairs again dirty also the table runner.food wise the breakfast is good also the dinner buffet with plenty of choices available. we tried the fine dining restaurant one night and it was very good my wife taking the new zealang beef and me the 2 fish curry price wise of course dearer than the other two dining rooms but light years superior which you would expect if you pay more but not expensive to European prices. a bone of contention ,if you have a wine list then maybe the odd bottle is out of stock,but it got to the point all that was left was the expensive wines costing Â£25 plus for what we get at home for Â£6 now I know all about mark ups but rip off! the daytime was spent by the resident only pool as this was the quietist and the pool attendant was very good at arranging our beds and towels on the same vain all the staff were very good one or two thrown in at the deep end I suspect with a poor lack of English in the restaurants. avoid the weekends as it fills up with locals on a freebie with their company and they are noisy and usually drunk playing drums at all hours. now while you are relaxing on your sun lounger near a pool you will be beckoned over to the hawkers trying to sell sarongs tee shirts or days out in a taxi,now they are not supposed to step over a line in the sand enforced by security guards but all day long they are shouting to you waving the sarongs etc,they stand on the boundary of the hotel and the beach which means the beach is a no go zone unless you don't mind saying no thank you many many times over. don't know what can be done they need to make a living you are trying to have a peaceful holiday. so to sum up after touring around sri lanka for a week we intended to chill out for 5 days didn't feel we achieved it so we do not recommend this overated hotel more 3 star.

text: We stayed 5 nights as an add-on to our two week island tour when the hotel was busy mainly with German, Russian and Ukrainian guests many of who were in large groups and are on all inclusive packages. Its is a quiet location on a beautiful beach with no other hotels nearby. Whilst we were there the sea was quite rough with a strong undercurrent. There is a well designed and maintained infinity pool, just off the lobby, that blends in with the sea giving the impression that you are actually in the sea. There is also another large pool elsewhere in the grounds. We were disappointed with the deluxe room that we were offered and so paid considerably more (although discounted) for a luxury suite upgrade which was very nice though was somewhat more than we needed though nothing else appeared to be available. The main restaurant (Jute) serves an excellent buffet as it offers a large choice of good quality international food though with probably less Asian dishes than we had at other hotels elsewhere. The groups sit at large tables in middle of this restaurant and can be quite noisy at dinner times. Our room hotel guide stated that attire for dinner was â€˜smart casualâ€™ though this was largely ignored by many guests and especially by some men who wore jeans, shorts, T shirts and football shirts. Beach fine dining was excellent with a good choice of dishes from an a la carte menu including some wonderful seafood. Attentive and friendly service made this a truly memorable occasion. There was a lack of sun beds and umbrellas around the pools and grounds. Also, the sun beds and towels were old and many of the beds were broken or had wheels missing so there was the daily early morning rush to get towels on good beds with umbrellas. The hotel needs to invest money in buying new furniture and towels to ensure there are enough for all guests. Lunchtime food at the pool bar was limited to burgers, sandwiches and half a dozen other snacks which really should be supplemented by some salads and some more Asian snacks. Service in the grounds Service away from the two pools was infrequent and we usually had to walk to the bar to buy drinks. We have discussed our views with a representative of the hotels management (Dinusha Kularatne) who says he will be writing a report detailing our comments. It's a good hotel but it didn't live up to our expectations of the luxury hotel we wanted at the end of our holiday.

text: We stayed at this hotel for a week at the end of a touring holiday in Sri Lanka. It is claimed to be the only five-star hotel on this coast, which is not entirely accurate. In some aspects the hotel is very good - the two huge swimming pools, large public areas, well spread-out accommodation & nicely-appointed rooms - and deserves its five stars. However, there are some aspects which are not five-star and were a source of irritation during our stay. For example, on the whole, the food was very good but tended to be served not very hot, and is rather expensive for what it is. We tried the buffet, which is OK, but very expensive. We had several meals in the Coffee Shop, which is more reasonable in price but, despite being a la carte, we twice had to send food back because it was virtually cold. Getting things like that fixed, which would happen promptly in a real 5-star hotel, seemed to take an age. Service is helpful & charming, but inept and inefficient at times. There often seems to be no-one on duty with sufficient authority to make a decision about things. Complaints are handled by constantly referring them to some-one else, who often is not in a position to actually do anything, other than telling someone else. The staff are not very quick to clear up after the rain sweeps into the public areas (which are tiled) leaving very slippery surfaces around for too long. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel, but I think they could try harder to merit their 5-star tag.

text: Right on the beach, 2 beautiful pools, and really lovely staff - who are definitely the major asset. But WHY do the bathrooms look so unclean? our shower screen was limescaled (heavily), the floors and walls needed upgrading as they were scuffed and marked and impossible to clean (polished concrete walls au naturel! - but evidently the architect who designed them loves the effect so it doesn't matter!). On the plus side the bed was wonderfully comfortable. Breakfast was in a low ceilinged dark room (often smokey from the cooking of bacon or hoppers) - where you help yourselves but have to wait for tea/coffee (i.e. flag down a waiter if you can catch their eye - although there are always plenty of them around) - and geared to Big Appetites and touring parties. The dinner buffet food in the same room was lukewarm and no one attends it to ensure it is stirred/kept hot. The menus are very restricted. Where are all the delicious tastes of Sri Lanka? Why travel all this distance to eat (mediocre) European food! The middle range restaurant (I think it was called Mustard) with a terrace overlooking the pool was the best, as the food was cooked to order, and the staff more than willing to experiment with something off the menu if they had the ingredients. The beauty salon was staffed by wonderful Balinese girls who gave a very good deep tissue massage - but the standard of the treatment rooms (just converted bedrooms) was poor. Expect more ambience for the price. Not 5* by European/International standards and more expensive for food/drink than the Amangalla or the Galle Face. The hotel facilities need upgrading to earn their stars!

text: We booked a double room and from the time of our arrival it felt like we were in a quarantine facility. For a beach hotel that should exude a relaxed vibe, the entire entry was roped off!! We were taken over by a hostess from the time of arrival and directed like school children - "stay here, do that, etc". Walked through an xray scanner which is quite okay but which was the only entry. Ordered to sit down, ordered to wear masks etc. It is a really open space and we are all triple vaccinated. The elevators were not working. The room was good but was definitely overrun with moisture issues. "Double" meant two single beds pushed together!! Tried to order a cocktail in the bar but was told that because of "supply issues" only Arrack cocktails were available. Had dinner in the coffee shop and were served french fries cooked in rancid Coconut Oil!! When asked why, was told "supply issues". I was offered a replacement but wondered how was I going to receive a replacement if there was indeed a supply issue?? Was a victim of overt racism at breakfast. As a Sri Lankan, I was singled out and ordered to wear a mask!! At a buffet!! All the other non Sri Lankan guests were exempted including my partner. I did complain to the restaurant manager who was very receptive and apologetic. Tried walking on the beach - impossible. All the vendors and touts just follow you around and obviously there is no control from the hotel. Overall a disappointing experience

text: We have just spent over a week at the much vaunted Geoffrey Bawa designed Heritance Hotel. We enjoyed our week on the coast but find it tough to rate the hotel better than average. No doubt in its day the hotel would have been considered ahead of its time however today its minimalist design and decor highlight the fact that hotel is getting tired. The rooms have apparently been renovated recently and they are OK however the public areas are uninspiring. We visited a number of hotels on the coast while in the area. It was noticeable how many are either new - Chaaya at Hikkaduwa or recently upgraded - and Surf and Avani at Bentota, or in the process of being renovated - Vivanta by Taj at Bentota. The latter, based on the upgrade we saw to date, is going to be fantastic. The Heritance will need to watch its competition. The beach is nice once you've been rude to the touts to keep them off. Tourist information is not readily available and most things you'll want to do are away from Ahungalla. We got most information and help in getting around from the on site taxi drivers who can arrange pretty much anything including motor bike hire which despite the local traffic we would recommend. Tuk Tuk drivers outside the hotel are bad news - rude and argumentative which we didn't find anywhere else. Finally the hotel entertainment is amateurish. At +US350 a night it wasn't cheap for what it is.

text: Since we had already experienced the exceptional hospitality at Heritance Kandalama and The Sands at Kalutara (Aitken Spence properties), we booked our Christmas vacation at Heritance Ahungalla a couple of months back to avoid disappointment. When we arrived at the property we were pleasantly surprised to find out that we had been upgraded to the Luxury Suite with the garden balcony. The Suite (room 324) was HUGE compared to a regular room, in fact if I am not mistaken, the bathroom of the suite probably had the same square footage as a regular room, with a 2 person bathtub, a shower stall, double sinks and a huge walk in closet. The suite was richly appointed with real furniture including a small library. My 13yr old was thrilled to find an age appropriate book by Rick Riordan that she had not previously read. The bedroom had a comfortable king sized Four Poster bed and a recliner. Mini fridge, TV, surround sound system and tea/coffee service rounded off the comforts. Food was excellent as this hotel's chefs had emerged as the Most Outstanding Culinary Team in Sri Lanka after competing against both international and domestic star-class city and resort hotels at the 15th Culinary Art Competition. Sous chef Roshan Pujitha was kind enough to show us some of the culinary masterpieces and their chocolate factory. Most nights were theme nights, and on the night where they served Chinese food, we were prepared to order A la Carte for our daughter who has nut allergies, but the server quickly brought her a plate of Lasagna from another restaurant at no extra charge. the wait staff was attentive and responded to our requests in a timely manner. The rooms were clean and well stocked with fresh towels, bath robes and bottled water. The room steward came every evening to make sure we had fresh towels and to turn down the beds. Fresh fruit was also delivered to the room. The only issue we had was, we wanted the vacation over Christmas, but we were told that the hotel was booked solid. This was not the case as there were plenty of vacant rooms available. This was a bit of a disappointment since we really wanted to be away during Christmas. It was a pleasant surprise to meet Ms Niranjala the hostess, who was also at Heritance Kandalama during our visit to that property in August, and she recognized us and came over to chat. It was an enjoyable experience and a great vacation.

text: This place was amazing. From our arrival we felt very welcome here. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They were always on hand to help with a smile and were immaculate in presentation. text: We spent 10 nice days at the Heritance Ahungalla in april 2015. To summarize, the stay was in general a good one. The setting is wonderful indeed. Spectacular beach. Great weather. The hotel as such is not bad at all. However, given the fact that it is supposed to be on the upper end, and that is has been designated the title Travelers Choice, we expected a lot more. This is more like a mid-range family resort. The good: Wonderful surroundings, sea view from the balcony, tasteful spacious rooms with a well-regulated AC. Great breakfast. Pretty good food quality in general. Friendly service. The headwaiter acted very professionally and listen very carefully and arranged adjustments when we complained about the buffÃ© dinner. The Bad: Dinner is a BuffÃ©, served in an environment reminding you of an elementary school. Let us say - not very cozy. They brag about their fine dining restaurant, which serves excellent lobster (hence, you should go there once) at a quite high price, but the rest is nothing special. Expect â‚¬40-50 for a bottle of wine anywhere in the hotel. It is a family resort. Some days the pool area is crowed with screaming kinds, despite that pool rules say: NO GAMES. The staff does nothing to moderate. Between the hotel and the beach there is an area with palms and bushes. In the shade, a dozen or so sales men and women do their best to attract the attention of the guests all day long. Hello, hello! Our plane departed late so our travel agent suggested that we should ask for a late check out. Initially the response sounded as if that most likely could be arranged, but somehow the hotel was fully booked on the Monday morning when we should leave, so we had to leave the room and take the shower in a cramped public shower with no shower gel and no space to leave your belongings. That was the end of a glamorous holiday. Well, maybe not. Suggestions to management: 1. Dinner: Try to do something about the elementary school dining room. Serve the BuffÃ© twice at 19 and then again at 20:30. Make sure that the food is fresh all the time. 2. Mixing families and couples: You have two pools. Why not enforce strict quiet behaviour at either pool and let the kids play at the other. Everyone will be happy. 3. Public showering facilities: It is warm. People are the for swimming. Make sure they can take a shower in a respectable bathroom before they say goodbye. It will be the last impression they take with them back home as they say Au revoir.

text: Every so often even the mighty falter. What matters is recovery. After an impressive check-in, things went south at dinner. Inattentive service, cold food and total apathy left me wondering if this was the wrong place to spend three nights. I usually provide feedback at the end of my stay, but this bothered me enough that I penned an email to the corporate office that very evening. I did not expect a quick response. The next morning, with a fair amount of trepidation, I went for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised when a staff member approached me and apologized for the unpleasant experience the evening before. Before long another two managers stopped by to offer their apology. The balance of my stay was perfect. This property is beautiful. I was fortunate enough to get a room with an incredible view. The accommodations were comfortable and technologically up to date. The pool is huge and strategically located within 10 meters of the beach. I was on a half board plan and had the breakfast and dinner buffets during my stay. Good selection as well as taste. One of the days I ate lunch in one of the restaurants that offers a la carte service. I asked the chef to prepare lobster Sri Lankan style and it was absolutely delightful. All in all an excellent place for holiday in the Galle district.

text: Overall I would say this is a superb hotel and would definately recommend it to anyone wanting a relaxing place to stay. The hotel is very clean, the rooms are large and spacious and all the staff are very accomodating. The two infinity pools are lovely and the loungers around them can be moved in to the shade very easily or in to the sun when required. As we went off peak it was incredibly quiet and for 3 days there were only 2 couples around the second pool. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms well equipped with large showers and always immaculately clean. Breakfast was always very good with a huge range of food, with omlettes freshly cooked to order. Try the Egg Hoppers! Evening meals were available in the main restaurant generally tended to be from a set menu and were always a high standard - although the Sri Lankans tend to put two different dishes on one course. The Coffee Shop was also very good - you have to try Rice an Curry - a real treat. The Negative Points: On two occassions I sent food back only to have the original food returned........ the first was a chicken burger which I specifically requested to have no cheese on, it was returned with cold chips and the cheese scraped off - absolutely disgusting in my book and they were very apologetic about it. However the waiter spilt an orange juice over another plate of food and said he would get a fresh one, but when he returned the food was still soaked with OJ and underneath the salad there were remnants of the juice, so once again the plate had just been wiped down. I understand they were incredibly quiet but keeping costs down at the expense of the guest is not on. At weekends a lot of Sri Lankans tend to come and stay and the hotel becomes incredibly noisy. If you like early nights and peaceful sleeping I would definately recommend you request a room away from the main pool area. We arrived and were put in to a room facing the main pool and just on walking in the room knew it would be too noisy. We could still clearly hear the Fri and Sat night entertainment in our replacement room and Sat night there was really loud music on until midnight. If you value some peace ask for rooms at the far ends of the hotel. A word of warning regarding the beach hawkers...... unfortunately we had a bad experience with Emile De Silva, we arranged a couple of trips and an evening meal at the Sunshine Restaurant. Whilst the trips were 'ok' I felt crowded by having him, a driver and someone else join us (a trick for getting more money out of us by asking for bigger tips), they rushed us around the nice places and didn't really give us any space and didn't deliver on the glass bottomed boat, whilst still wanting the same money. The evening meal also never materialised with 2 different excuses given and then making us walk miles down the beach to another location which was actually on the road. We lost 1000 rupees as we refused to go as they had not told us earlier in the day there was a problem. Otherwise the other people on the beach were great, the ladies selling the 'sari's' were great fun and whilst they did try and call us over all the time they were lovely. Whilst the negative points above need to be considered, please don't let it put you off. The hotel was wonderful and all the staff would fall over themselves to help. It certainly looks by far the most superior hotel on that coastline. We have certainly agreed we will be returning in 2 years time. Tourism in Sri Lanka is desperately needed and when you spend your money you are treated like Kings. Tip: Take a trip to Unawatuna - a stunning little beach outside Galle which was charming and filled with the locals.

text: The hotel is very beautiful and has 2 pools, and spa facilities. One of the pools had a live entertainer playing some sort of traditional flute. The location of the hotel is convenient as it's directly next to the beach. We tried the massage and the spa facility, and it was very good, although a bit expensive when compared to other 5 star hotels in Sri Lanka. The rooms were tidy and well equipped. The bathroom is a bit small, but up to the standards. As with previous Heritance hotel we visited, the bottles of shampoo and shower gel need to be reviewed from an ergonomic point of view. They are difficult to pour from, either you pour too little or too much. On the down sides, the check-in process took around 30 to 40 minutes. Not sure why. The buffet was a disappointment. After all the great things we encountered in this hotel, we were looking forward to an amazing gastronomic experience. However the buffet was poor in terms of both variety and quality. We happened to be at the hotel on a full moon (Buddha Day), which is a holiday in Sri Lanka. Maybe that was the reason for the bad quality of the buffet, due to lack of staff? I'm not really sure. In general it was a pleasant experience and would recommend staying at the hotel.

However the security guards did not stop this from happening and we will not be returning to this hotel.

text: Had mixed feelings about the hotels. I was not bad but was never 5 star. The check in could have been done in a more pleasing manner. The staff was too harsh, not even with a proper smile on the face to welcome the guests. The much needed cold towels were not provided. We stayed in a standard room and is quite ok though three's nothing outstanding. The furniture was of good quality and the rooms had a prestigious look. We stayed in a tripple and the extra bed was a total disappointment. The mattress was terrible. The verandah of the room was nice and big. Toothbrushes, tooth pastes and a shaving kit was missing in the room. I had to give a few calls to get them to my room. there was central air conditioning with temperature control, but yet the temperature controller seemed not to work right. The bathroom was ok but could have been bit more large. The common areas of the second and the third floor was neither air conditioned nor had proper ventilation. So you can hardly relax on a sofa there. the food was good. had nice sea food. But need to have a few notches up to get it to 5 star level. The service was terrible. the staff is too harsh. No body has a smile on their face and you would have a real unpleasant situation. Those in the dining were ignorant of the guest's needs. During the dinner I had to ask five times to get a bottle of water. They take hours to prepare a new table. A really inefficient staff lacking the professionalism. The two pools were really good. both really large and well maintained. The green pool has a great privacy and is much better than the main one. That of course is 5 star. The towels by the pools were too old and doesnt sute for the five star quality. If you are finding some nice hotel to stay near Galle and if your budget permits the best would be the "The Fortress" Koggala and even the light house hotel may do better.

text: Lovely looking hotel with a beautiful location. A few irritations though - no soap in the rooms, just two empty soap boxes in the bathroom bin! The boutique appeared to have exactly what I was looking for, but despite three trips to the shop and finding the "open" sign in the window, the door was locked and nobody was there. As we had to depart, I didn't have time to try to find someone. On arrival we had to remind the reception staff to give us back our passports. And there was extraordinarily loud drumming below our room for perhaps 45 minutes after dinner! We presumed there must have been some sort of cultural show on that we hadn't been told about. We were just starting to get really tired of it when it stopped. We had dinner in our room, and it was served quite promptly and was delicious. Breakfast was also delicious, with a great variety. Despite this list of irritations, the hotel was quite lovely, and if we had been staying longer, we would have taken the trouble to sort them out.

text: We were there for two days ie 06 and 07 Dec. Let me objectively articulate the good thinga and things which needs improvement: Good ones 1. Well kept resort with private access to the beach 2. Huge open swimming pool which from the reception provides an illusion as if the pool is merging into the sea..a visual delight 3. Nice rooms with a balcony and I was told all rooms were sea facing Areas for improvement: 1. The access to the beach or otherwise ia uncontrolled ie no real security or barricade ..there were outsiders/ touts soliciting business and no one controlled them. 2. Most guests were Europeans and no wonder ..the entire menu was made to cater to their preferences barring a few local items 3. The menu for both dinner and breakfast practically remained unchanged thru our stay 4. Though the staff and chef were helpful, they probably had little clue about Indian dishes / ingredients/ taste. Despite their beat effort to provide one odd dish especially for us, the food experience was far from satisfactory. So if you are Indian and crave for Indian food ...this ia not the place for you. In contrast, all other places we stayed in SriLanka ie Kandy, Nuwara Eliya or Colombo, there were some Indian dishes on offer and some of them tasted good too. 4. Lastly , despite making a special request for cake/ flowers for our anniversary and reminding that very morning again, they messed it all up. Finally with the intervention of our travel agent they did bring a cake but by then the damage was done. It also gave me a feeling that they are probably still under slave mindset of licking the white skun. Thus on balance, 3 to 3.5 stars is what I will give

text: We travelled as a family and stayed in a deluxe suite, so had plenty of room. The furnishings in the room were a little dated, and the hotel as a whole could do with a revamp. There is a new luxury 5 star hotel being built next door, and I wondered whether the Heritance is gradually sliding to the rung below international luxury hotel, so as not to have direct competition. The food and service here were definitely substandard in comparison to the other hotels on our trip (Ulagalla, Anantaya and Jetwing Lighthouse and Yala), and our son ended up with food poisoning on our last evening, nearly delaying our return home. It was hard to get a table in the restaurant, and once seated it was hard to get the staff's attention for any drinks. The hotel was not very responsive to requests (we had problems with ants in the room, a lamp not working and a couple of other things) but the boy looking after our room was very attentive. Having said that, the hotel was very helpful about allowing us to use another room on the day of departure so that we could continue to use the facilities. I think there was a laundry issue: each time we asked for pool towels we were told there weren't any, but they did eventually materialise from a tumble dryer. Service at the pool bar was extremely erratic and inconsistent - we usually had to walk up to the bar to get attention. The stretch of beach by the hotel was lovely, and the currents not as strong as in some places, but still a risk for swimming. There was often entertainment on the beach, but two days after fireworks, the debris was still littering the beach. You have a great stretch of sand, don't ruin it! All in all, the hotel gives the impression of a gradual decline, which is a shame. Our room (at the very end of a corridor) was very quiet, but our friends stayed in a suite nearer to the main part of the hotel (329, I think) where you could hear all the entertainment all evening.

text: I spent the Christmas weekend at the hotel. An absolutely beautiful property with a beautiful clean stretch of beach and the most mesmerizing sunsets! The major failure was the room. It was quite small and old and definitely wasn't maintained properly. Cleanliness of the room was not up to par for the price I paid especially during the peak holiday season. From table tops to curtains to the wash room, here was dust all over as if it was not cleaned in months. I had to clean the blow dryer with a wet tissue to get the dirt out before using it! There was also a very old TV in the room. Food was okay, not great but the staff was very friendly and very helpful. It makes your stay a worthy one against all odds. There are two great pools and a garden with a lot of trees. Well maintained and the pool staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely like to go back if the room quality and standards improves in the future.

text: We travelled around Sri Lanka for 2 weeks staying in 6 different hotels, and this was by far the worst service we received out of our entire stay. The hotel itself is nice, rooms spacious and clean, pool area is nice. We dined in the a la carte restaurant which was nice. Donâ€™t bother with half board / all inclusive - thereâ€™s a handful of restaurants on the beach with better food. The worst part is there seems to be some American expectation of tipping for absolutely everything, and if you donâ€™t then you simply wonâ€™t get served!! Despite many signs around the pool saying sunbeds canâ€™t be reserved, it seems the pool boy is more than happy to reserve these for a tip. I was up at 7:30am (jetlag), and there was just 1 set of sunbeds left despite no one actually being by the pool! We stayed there until midday, and some of the reserved beds only became occupied at 11am! So frustrating for everyone else. One woman took the reservation off and the pool boy flat out refused to give her a towel, even arguing with her! She went and got her own, and by midday no one had come to claim the bed! Awful! We went to the bar one night, they saw us walk in. They proceeded to offer every other group table service but us! I had to go to the bar 3 times for menus, drink etc., yet they still charged 10% service! On check-out you get shoved in some tiny room round back to pay your bill which is actually quite intimidating. No one asked if we had a nice stay or where we were going next, or even said bye when we left! While I do appreciate Sri Lanka is a poor country and tipping is needed, this was the only hotel during our whole trip that had this greedy mentality. We saved hard for this trip and donâ€™t appreciate being treated like lesser people because we donâ€™t have lots of extra money for tips! They also seem to have no problem in letting touts in to the hotel who come up to you on your sunbed to sell you a sari! I get that this happens on the beach but they shouldnâ€™t allow them in the hotel grounds.

text: Our room at the hotel was very impressive but sadly quite noisy. You could hear everything from the corridors and in the room above. The hotel itself was a bit tired. The green swimming pool was amazing and usually quite quiet but the main pool was very busy all the time and with lots of children playing games so it was not very peaceful. The setting is lovely and the beach is really very beautiful, we enjoyed spending time on it. The staff were well meaning and friendly however we did have a few issues. I think perhaps not all of what we said/asked was understood but instead of asking to clarify they said yes and just said of course, no problem. This meant that we had a couple of situations which left us with problems. We booked a PCR test and expressly asked if the cost could be charged to our room. We were told that this was fine and no problem, then when we came to do the test we were told we needed to pay in cash which we did not have. The hotel did. It do anything to help and we found ourselves roaming the streets in the midday heat desperately trying to find a cash machine and very stressed. We also arranged a late check out which we had to pay for. We agreed this and then confirmed it the next day. Despite this on the day of check out we got a call saying we needed to vacate the room. We queried this and confirmed what we had arranged previously and were told they didnâ€™t have anything on their system and we would need to clear our room straight away but they could put us in another room. We were not packed or prepared for this and the whole thing turned out last day into a really stressful and ruined day.

text: This is a nice hotel. We generally enjoyed our stay, but qualified by the comment below. Special commendation for the hotel's service staff who were very helpful and pleasant. The qualification: The hotel website features photos of lovely views of the ocean from the hotel's main dining areas and pool. Moreover, we booked a "premium" room to enjoy the view of the beach and the ocean that comes with these rooms. A guest of the hotel should have a reasonable expectation that was is displayed on the website regarding visual amenity is what they will get if they book. However, for much of our stay, the hotel's beach-side amenity was marred by the construction and deconstruction (over four days) of a large marquee running the entire length of the hotel's main access way to the beach. This marquee does not appear in any photo on the hotel's website. Its presence, in my view, thus represents a breach, however minor, of the contract between hotel and guest. Because full-fee-paying hotel guests were not put first in this regard, it is unlikely that we will return to this hotel.

text: Pros: 1. Nice staff, ready to help in all matters (if you give them a tip, and they expect it). 2. Beautiful area with many animals (monkeys, palm squirrels, monkeys) 3. Nice pools Minuses: 1. All rooms located around the lobby are forced to listen to VERY loud music until 11-12 pm (our beds literally almost vibrated). We had to move further away because it was impossible to rest. 2. The choice of food only seems large, the spiciness is not indicated anywhere, so you had to take it at random. There is nothing at all for children. If you have stomach problems, you will have nothing to choose from. In fact, the only fruits were papaya, pineapple and unleavened watermelons. Sometimes I have bananas for breakfast. 3. The staff in the dining room is very slow - drinks were sometimes brought by the end of the meal 4. You should not take excursions from the guys on the beach - they will charge you twice as much and will try to take you to every place where they have a kickback. It's better to leave the hotel and negotiate with the tuk-tukers there. 5. To get to the ocean you need to break through a crowd of very intrusive locals who are trying to push everything on you - by the end of your vacation itâ€™s already starting to irritate you. Not a minus of the hotel itself, but you wonâ€™t be able to swim in the ocean - the waves are quite shallow. No one has change, so count on it and change it for small money right away, otherwise you will also overpay.

text: Well The overall experience is not bad.. The two Pools were clean, big and had a good time swimming.. But the Jacuzzi pools were not clean.. Was very unpleasant to get in.. staff is friendly and supportive, except the staff in the buffet area.. Its like they are annoyed with the guests who are dining there.. I recommend this hotel for a get away with avarage expectations.. Surely not upto five star standards specially compared to herritance kandalama.. The reception staff was very nice.. The check in was easy and quick.. Beach was clean.. Place is quiet and peaceful.. Just some improvements are needed to keep up the five star standards..
