text: Booked this hotel as part of our tour of sri lanka , it was the last one having stayed in 4 other hotels .Recommended to us and overall it was a nice hotel but let it self down in certain areas. Arrival was pleasant and we had a slight delay before going to the room , which was very nice spacious but in need of some improvements . wardrobe doors did not close on the runners , blinds in the bathroom had no function to close them , did report to reception but nothing done . Pool area very nice always able to get a sun lounger two pools available and the attendants were first class in providing towels and arranging the beds for you . Staff in the restaurants and bar areas were also first class being both attentive and professional. Only down side the evening was based around the pool and i feel they need to provide a better more comfortable seating arrangement instead of the same seating for the daytime pool drinking and eating tables and chairs . food and drink was good with a good choice and selection . beach is lovely but quiet due to , beach sellers and men pushing their taxi business which disrupts the relaxing environment , they stay behind a line of flags but it is close to the sun loungers. overall this is a nice hotel and nice beach side location nothing outside the resort if you go B+B then you must eat in the hotel which can work out expensive . The let down for us was the last day , most flights out of sri lanka are late evening , we were due to be collected at 21.30 . The room had to be vacated at 12.00 ( no late room available ). At 12.00 which was embarassing a member of the reception team came and cut off the all inclusive bands when we were with other guests. this is the first hotel which stopped the all inclusive many hours before we left . also if you want that shower prior to departing then they wont provide a room , we had to shower in the pool shower which is also the toilet nowhere to hang clothes or dry your hair . this was a disappointment to me which let the experience of the hotel down and which in my opinion stopped it being classed as a 5 Star , the sri lankan people were great i will return again but not to this hotel , i did read the reviews and thought i could ignore the beach sellers but it did spoil it . couple in our 40's

text: After visiting Sri Lanka 4 times over the last 6 or 7 years visiting several different hotels, I have to say I wasnâ€™t overly impressed with the Hotel. We stayed for a week in January and to be honest the hotel was ok, the staff were great and the setting beautiful. But I have to buck the trend of good reviews because to be honest the food was average at best. As mentioned above my wife and I have visited Sri Lanka many times without any issues. But unfortunately by the second night my wife and I came down with severe diarrhoea and stomach cramps which lasted the whole week. This could have only been the food or drink because we always drink bottled water. You also dont expect ongoing hotel maintenance in high season with mobile scaffold in the hotel entrance and around the front of the pool for 3 days. Seeing men with breathing equipment sending huge clouds of white smoke into the air in the courtyard outside our room. It was so bad we had to put a towel at the bottom of our door. All together if wasnâ€™t for the setting and the staff it would have been a poor stay in a 5 star resort.

text: I am surprised at the number of glowing reviews this hotel has received. Either my wife and I were unlucky, too hard to impress, or other reviewers for this hotel were being too kind. Ill start with the positives. The hotel grounds are very nice, the pool is excellent, the location right on the beach very nice. The rooms are ok, they have everything you might expect or want. Nothing more or less. However this hotel seems to follow the usual business model you find in these types of regions. Hire the cheapest staff you can find, provide only the basic training, charge the guests international rates, make a fortune on high margins. Staff were slow and spoke very little english. They cannot engage in conversation which is frustrating when you need to ask about the local area, request extra food items, or anything you might require. There was no imagination, such beautiful grounds yet no outdoor BBQ for guests during the day or night, outdoor pool bar, or even music. And then there is the idea of apparent supplementation of hotel income by allowing corporate/local guests in with their families in tow on weekends. About 20 screaming kids in the pool and all the deck chairs taken forcing guests like myself to retreat somewhere else. I just dont expect this at a hotel that wants be considered in the luxurious category. Food was overpriced for the quality. It was fine, just not what you would expect for the price. Staff would take away an empty bottle and just fail to ask if you wanted another. Basic stuff. Staff are just in a constant state of apathy. I found myself having to look for the barman, find the guy to bring my wife and I the towels for the pool area. They were just never where you wanted them to be. When you did they were slow and emotionless. And the hawkers waiting outside the hotel limits on the beach. I mean that put me off straight away. We couldnt go anywhere without being accosted by these people. If I want a poorly made garment Ill go the street market myself thanks. Other guests actually hesitated walking on to the beautiful beach just so they didnt have to interact with these people. How is that fair? Upon checkout, my wife and I sat in the lobby area for 35 minutes as we waited for our driver and werent offered a single beverage/refreshment. Guess once you check out you arent worth the time anymore? Given so many of us only have only a few weeks a year allotted for holidays due to work commitments, its heartbreaking not getting what you think you are paying for. I think the Heritance Ahungalla has become complacent due to all the kind reveiws. When compared to the surrounding area it is 5 star quality, but internationally its 3 star at best. Its not a bad hotel at all, just not that great. Therefore I gave it an "average" rating as its simply average. UPDATE: We have just checked in to the Fortress in Galle and it makes the Heritance look even worse. I wish we hadnt bothered with Ahungalla at all now. Im sure Ill get some half-hearted response from the management regarding my critique as they have done to others. I would have given it to them personally had they asked, but they never did.
cleaned_text: i am surprised at the number of glowing review this hotel ha received either my wife and i were unlucky too hard to impress or other reviewer for this hotel were being too kind ill start with the positive the hotel ground are very nice the pool is excellent the location right on the beach very nice the room are ok they have everything you might expect or want nothing more or less however this hotel seems to follow the usual business model you find in these type of region hire the cheapest staff you can find provide only the basic training charge the guest international rate text: We went to this hotel for a weekend stay with another family. Hotel looked very old but since this is a Geoffrey Bava creation itâ€™s still of so much value. We stayed for one night and was on full board basis. Food was average because of the variety. Sri Lankan food was there but still for a 5 star hotel not good enough. Staff were friendly but overall service needs to improve. They lacked energy and interests. Across the hotel we felt there was some sense of boredom. Room was ok but then again it looked old style if you like them. Overall this is a good hotel which may be in need of a new theme and a service upgrade.

text: My partner and I have arrived from the UK this afternoon and we knew instantly, that we had made a big mistake choosing this property as our base in Sri Lanka. The lobby has as much ambience as my mothers funeral in September!!!!!! It is dark, unwelcoming, cold,uncomfortable furnishings and lacks any kind of warmth and inviting environment. We had paid for an upgrade on our room prior to leaving the UK with a double bed deluxe sea view. We got neither. Room was damp with a smell of urine from the bathroom. Interior was again dark with numerous scratches on furniture. No ocean view and two twin beds put together and the safe was not secure to anything!!!!! Tiles missing from the bathroom and no kettle,ironing board and iron!! The list is endless. Complained to the management and the front of house manager did state some of the rooms had not been upgraded in thirty five years. We were moved to another room which was supposed to be an upgrade. Alas not. Toilet that leaks, as well as the air conditioning: no secure safety box and the smell of fresh paint. Have eaten n the restaurant this evening. Best described as bland, average and uninspiring. We have already been in touch with our tour operator to move us or we will be returning early home. The only positive are the very friendly staff. If any of the hotel management read this we are in room 355. If you want luxury, with the added little touches do not come here, save your money and go elsewhere.

text: I have been to Heritance Ahungalla many many times. It is a second home to my family and my first choice for a family holiday, for an office trip or for a corporate training event. The difference at Heritance Ahungalla is the consistency in service and the courtesy and assistance extended by all, from the GM to a steward or housekeeping staff. Very innovative in everything they do, excellent rooms and delightful cuisine. I will never forget the 'ice-cream sandwich' served after an outdoor training session I had Heritance. The welcome and the departure is equally warm, which is not common - Gihan Talgodapitiya

text: The hotel is generally good. I was informed that it had been hit by the tsunami in 2004 and all the ground floor rooms were submerged. I travelled in a group and somehow got upgraded to a large deluxe room which was fantastics with all the trimmings. The room was spacious with a great view. However, my friends who were in standards rooms didn't like their stay at all. They complained about the rooms having flying cockroaches. The culinary experience was not as great as I hoped considering the hotel was voted as being the Best in Culinary Experience in Sri Lanka. Maybe because I was comparing with Hilton Colombo where I had just come from and which I would rate as better. The gym was ok but the electic equipment such as treadmills and cross trainers could use an upgrade. The gym is open throughout i.e. it's never locked which is great for flexibility. The swimming pools are very inviting and the meeting room were provided was ok though the selection of coffee/ tea beak snacks could be improved. One thing that was interesting was the sea was rough all the time throughout our stay. No guests could swim in the sea at all. This is a very interesting phenomenon which i had not previously experienced.

text: I have such mixed feelings about this hotel but Iâ€™m confident in saying that this is not up to the standards of a 5 star. We stopped here for the last week of our 2 week trip to Sri Lanka for our honeymoon and on arrival to the hotel from the lobby/main gates it looked exceptional! On arrival to our â€œdeluxeâ€ room we were instantly disappointed. The room apparently had just been refurbished which I found really hard to believe. The shower was covered in limescale and the room was tiny. After a bit of a battle we were finally allocated another room. This room was slightly bigger but the bathroom was once again the bathroom was again covered in limescale, half decorated, very basic and we couldnâ€™t see anything deluxe or 5 star about it. Earlier in the week we stayed in a deluxe room at a sister hotel â€˜Heritance Kandalamaâ€™ and the room there had an amazing view, whirlpool bath & amazing decorâ€¦ so as you can imagine we were really disappointed with this room. Iâ€™ve attached a couple of photos for reference too. The food was really really good at the buffet and snack bar and we thought the verity of alcohol provided on the all inclusive was good. The staff were friendly but there wasnâ€™t enough staff and they couldnâ€™t keep up with how many people were there. I personally wouldnâ€™t recommend to anyone looking for luxury to stay here and agree with the below comments that this is an equivalent of a European 3 star hotel. Finally, it seems that the management and staff prioritise the returning customers which is such a shame as if they put the effort in to new customers (especially ones who have spent a considerable amount of money on honeymoons) too along with a few touch ups, theyâ€™d receive better reviews.

text: Excellent food but poor service.
cleaned_text: excellent food but poor service

text: When entering the hotel all the guests and bag are being checked by secirity personnels and metal detectors which is a good move to reassure safety. Valet parking is available. We were warmly welcomed and the reception was very busy atthe time we were checking-in. We were offered a welcome drink and a small snack as well as a refreshing face towel. The garden was neat and the lobby area was quite large and spacious. Furniture and the decor was modernised vintage looking. The room was looking so inviting and the lighting did its magic with the look of a lavishly renovated early bunglow. The bed was comfortable and so were the sheets and pillows. The view from our room was partially to the ocean and eventhough it was not directly centered at the ocean, the view of the sea from our room was spectacular. The food was on a buffet set-up and all of what I tried was delicious. Yet, I believe that the variety could have been improved, specially the breakfast service. On the other hand, the dinner was excellent! However, the lunch might not be the best buffets of Heritance Ahungalla I suppose. The buffet quality might be pressed down as a result of low rates being charged in this season to attarct more guests to the hotel. Moreover, the spa was relaxing and the therapists did their part well. Above all, the fragrance in the spa was fantastic. Unfortunately, we had a bad night. After having dinner, a function started at the hotel and we guessed that it was in the lobby area. It was extremely loud and we could not relax in the balcony or sleep inside. I am sure a manager or some authoritative personnel could have made a change in the location of the function. I understand that it was raining in the evening but the hotel might have a certain policy in terms of having functions at the hotel. There is ample space in the property and there might be a better place or a separate place to have functions. So, please make sure that such problems do not occur in the future. The aim of a hotel is to make all the guests delighted in their stay and not making "some" of the guests happy.

text: A very warm, welcoming, beautiful resort. Our family spent 6 nights at the Heritance and will more than likely book again for the location and price. We booked online for a suite at a really good rate. As there was no way to book a luxury suite, we were hoping to be upgraded at checkin. As we are a large family, the benefit of the luxury suites 2 bathrooms would have been great. Unfortunately there were no luxury suites available when we arrived. Our room was clean and comfortable. We did notice the shower/bath combo would not drain properly and also collected a lot of water on the tubs edges which would spill onto the floor. We made do with towels placed in strategic locations. The food was very good and we absolutely loved the huge swimming pool. We even swam during a thunder shower. The location served as a great base to see all of the other sites Sri Lanka had to offer. Every staff member from the waiters, to the lifeguards, to the lovely gift shop employee was fantastic. Our kids were treated to a magic show, played pool and foosball, and loved the way our towels were folded into different animals upon arriving back to our room each night. Great stay!

text: The place was nice with beautiful views. The food was good but overpriced. Also the service was slow in the cafe. I think it was too expensive for the place and to charge almost 3500 lkr for a dinner buffet that had a great salad & dessert bar but the main foods was very limited. I am pretty sure they do not have generators because when the power was out there was backup current. I would recommend that you take a walk down to the beach and take a right to white villa restaurant or take a left to Jungle beach to eat. White Villa has an amazing lookout oint for a sunset....

text: We recently stayed here for two weeks and have to say had a great time. The hotel and grounds are lovely. It is right on the beach front which is beautiful. I can only comment on the room we had which was a deluxe room with partial sea view. The only reason it states partial is because there are palm trees and bushes between the room and view but it was lovely all the same. The room was spacious and had everything we needed. Lovely basket of fruit on arrival which was refreshed in the second week. Bottled water Daily and a mini fridge full of soft drinks, alcohol, crisps and chocolate. Rooms were cleaned daily and beds turned down each night, fresh towels twice a day. Lovely towel art left each day. The room cleaners really are a credit to the hotel. Although I have to say all the staff are a credit. All very helpful and pleased to help. Food was amazing. We were on an all inclusive basis which we wouldnâ€™t normally do but would recommend as not much nearby outside of the hotel. Great selection of meals all day. Have to say we were in curry heaven. Good selection for non curry eaters! Many reviews say Diet Coke isnâ€™t included in your drinks package which concerned me being diabetic, however they actually have Coke Zero which is included. Wine is only served at meal times in the A.I. Package. Two great pools in the grounds, we spent our time by the quiet pool. Bars were good but we spent most of our time at the pool bar were most of the entertainment was in the evenings. Some of the shows a bit bizarre but thatâ€™s A.I. for you. The days spent on the sun beds were filled with sightings of monitor lizards, chipmunk type creatures and monkeys roaming the grounds. Whilst here make sure you get out and about there is so much to see. We used a local guide who was a fraction of the price of tui who we travelled with. Found him prior to going and booked all our trips via him before going, didnâ€™t require payment until we arrived and met him personally.There are lots of local guides inc ones on the beach and the money stays local. *** Try Charu of czarek tours *** you can find him on Facebook or at charukadesilva5@gmail.com Also donâ€™t listen to tui when they say you have to use your rupees up before the airport or exchange what you have left in the departure lounge prior to going through security. You can spend them in the airport!! Finally we would like to thank all the staff at the Heritance for making our holiday so special. I would certainly stay here again if we return.

text: We booked for 2 nights unexpectedly as the election curfew messed with our original plans. The resort was mostly empty. It's not a full all-inclusive, meaning some guests pay a la carte. For the all-inclusive, the selection is OK - local spirits and a short list of cocktails. Wine is only served in the restaurant at lunch and dinner, which is weird. Food was good, but couldn't help the feeling that because it was not fully occupied the choice wasn't all there. The pool is nice, the beach is nearby (but not really a great beach, some serious surf). Rooms were OK, very clean, wifi was fast and the overall experience positive. Staff were extremely friendly and welcoming, which helped a lot. The gym was also a welcome addition - nothing big or fancy but there to be used, which is always a nice touch.

text: A popular beach hotel but itâ€™s no resort.

text: We've just returned from our honeymoon - a week in the Maldives(paradise) followed by a week in Sri Lanka staying in the Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel is beautiful just like any hotel in a major city let it be London, Dublin or New York so if its traditional Sri Lankan style your looking for than its not for you. Our room was looking out onto the ocean however the water was unfortunately too rough for swimming. There wasn't a soul on the beach for the entire duration of our trip apart from the usual hawkers who camp out on the beach for the day in the hope of selling the odd sarong or two. The food was nice but became extremely repetitive when your there for 6 days, bearing in mind there's nothing outside the hotel so no chance of eating anywhere else. If you like a drink and a bit of a buzz at nite then this is also not the hotel for you, the bars have no atmosphere.Your not encouraged to go out of the hotel however saying that there's nothing to go out for in the line of entertainment, shopping or eating just a little shop across the road which sells water and snacks which may come in handy as hotels prices are the same if not even more expenive than home. Once you walk out of the hotel you'll be surrounded by hawkers trying to sell you tours which can be annoying as they're fairly persistent. We went on a local tour by tuk tuk with Raji who camps out outside the hotel or beach, his English is perfect which helps. This was quite enjoyable apart from being brought to two different shops trying to get us to buy stuff, this is standard procedure if u take a tuk tuk anyway. We did the nearby river safari which we booked through our travel rep. This would be very managable and much cheaper to do by travelling by tuk tuk and hopping on a boat when you get there, just a few mins down the road. We also went to a national park spotting elephants, about 9 hrs in a car but enjoyable all the same.All of the staff in the hotel were outstanding very friendly and pleasant. Sri Lanka is really just a country for touring around, the ideal would be 4 or 5 days seeing the sights staying in a different hotel ever nite. As part of a tour I would defintely recommend a nite or two in this hotel but def no longer.

text: The sign next to reception says the hotel was voted the best 5 star hotel in Sri Lanka in 2010. If it's true then I just wonder what the rest must be like ! The original standard room was appalling and after complaining we were upgraded to a deluxe room which was good. All public areas are in need of refurbishment and there is a lack of any serious evening entertainment. Alcoholic drinks are some of the most expensive I have come across, either in Europe, Asia or the USA. The dinner experience in the Jute restaurant is mediocre, unless you like curry. It's a buffet and nothing is really hot. There appears to be a problem with the extractor fans and as the breakfast is cooked in the restaurant there is always a cloud of smoke circulating in the mornings.The room has a low ceiling and the decor is dark. The are two nice pools but the tiling around the edges is very uneven and loose. The beach is long and pleasant but the irritating, aggressive beach hawkers who stand ten metres away shouting to attract the attention of the guests make life unpleasant, they are a major problem. The beach has a lot of debris strewn about , bottles, polystyrene etc, but the management claim it is the job of the local council to clear it. As a previous poster has said, there is nothing close to the hotel and very little to do. For $150 per night it would be reasonable, but for the $300 per night ( b&b) we paid it is way overpriced. As Sri Lanka seems to have their own star rating system, I would rate this hotel on an international basis as no more than 3.5 stars. The staff go out of their way to be helpful

text: Having stayed at this hotel around 8 or 9 times over the last 20 years, we returned with high expectations. I am pleased to be able to say that the actual experience exceeded our expectations. We were given a large room on the top floor, well away from the restaurants and other potential sources of noise. The room was furnished beautifully and the bed was very comfortable. Everything was squeaky-clean and kept that way by our room boy, who also replenished our fruit bowl regularly. The hotel has a superb location at the end of a long beach and we were pleased to find that you can still stroll along its full extent without meeting more than a handful of people. There are two pools and plenty of sunbeds in the extensive garden area, where you can watch the many birds and chipmunks as well as the occasional monitor lizard passing through. We enjoyed the food, particularly the excellent dinner arranged for us by the head chef. The weather during our stay was pretty mixed, but we managed a few dinners at the seafood station by the side of the pool. I would recommend both the food and the relaxed atmosphere there.There is also a small covered 'open-air' restaurant area, where we had some good curries. Breakfast is a sumptuous affair with a wide range of choices, including hoppers and curries as well as the more traditional European-style offerings. There is also a splendid selection of fruit and juices. Whilst the hotel and its facilities are very good indeed, it was the friendliness and efficiency of the staff which really made our stay memorable. We were constantly surprised by the way in which people anticipated our wishes/preferences and provided what we were looking for - and much more - without ever having to ask for it. Truly exceptional service and hospitality! There were many familiar faces amongst the staff and we were also pleased to find that Eranda, our favourite tuk-tuk driver, was still offering his services by the gate. We have used him on many occasions and have found him very accommodating and utterly reliable. Resort areas such as Bentota and Hikkaduwa are within easy reach by tuk-tuk. We even went as far as Unawatuna this time - and enjoyed a 'roti lunch' with Eranda in Galle on the way. (Without him we would have struggled to order anything.) As the title above suggests, we have no complaints whatsoever. We only regretted not being able to stay longer. However, we will certainly try to come back.

text: We stayed at this hotel for twelve days and expected more from a hotel with a deluxe reputation. The greatest asset this hotel has are its staff. They were simply excellent, so very friendly, exceptionally eager to please and polite and courteous at all times. You would find it difficult to find a better hotel staff anywhere. The food in the buffet restaurant was of a high standard and a perfect mix of Sri Lankan and International dishes. The food in the fine dining restaurant was even better and probably better than manyy top restaurants in London. The hotel is located right on the beach andmost of the rooms have a great sea view. There are many beach venders, but we did not find this too much a problem as they quickly learnt not to bother you once you made it clear you were not interested. Yes, there are many positives to this hotel, but unfortunately it does not deserve a deluxe rating. First impression are so important and this hotel is let down by being in need of care and attention. For example the furnishings in the public areas were stained and needed replacing and much of the woodwork needed attention. The tablecloths in the dining room were frequently filthy (unacceptable and easily rectified) and all the linen needed to be renewed. Many of the sunbeds were broken and needed replacing and wer covered with dirty matresses. However, the pool attendents were excellent and helped to make up for these problems. Our overall impression of this hotel was that it required significant investment to bring it up to an acceptable standard for a deluxe hotel. The hotel is saved by its excellent staff and fabulous food; two of the most impotant factors for a successful hotel. Would we return, possibly, but only if standards were improved. There are many boutique hotels opening in Sri Lanka and the Heritance needs to be able to match the very high standard that these hotels set.

text: Well, if you like a large noisy hotel with shabby rooms and indifferent food, then this is the place for you. On the plus side the beach is pristine, and the inexperienced staff try their best. BUT it is a very large hotel which opens its doors to day trippers at the weekend, so the pool is full of screaming children. In the morning you cannot sit by the main pool because of the noise from speakers accompanying aerobics - ugh. The rooms are decorated in the bare plaster look which does not stand up to wear and tear. The food is average if you like buffets at specific times. A la carte is mainly burger and chips with variations. The prices for food are higher than the Hilton in Colombo, and what really annoyed me the most was that the hotel write up proports to show this as a 5* establishment, with prices to match when in fact I have stayed in many rest houses with better facilities.

text: We stayed for two weeks at the end of September after the hotel was highly recommended to us by a friend. From the moment we arrived we were treated to a true five star experience. Our room was a deluxe room overlooking the Green Pool with a view of the sea and we couldn't have asked for better. The bathroom had double sinks and the bed was better than our one at home. The buffet food was always fresh and inspiring and the chefs would always cook some plain chicken for my fussy 6 year old daughter. The restaurant staff, even when really busy, were always smiling and attentive. We were especially impressed by KK (Kumara) who went out of his way to make our family holiday incredible. He is a credit to the hotel as well as his colleague Thusara, who also looked after us. The bar staff were great, as were the canapÃ©s served with our delicious arrack. The pools were lovely to swim in, especially the Green Pool. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel, even though it's large it has the personal feel of a smaller hotel. It's also worth mentioning that we booked the hotel with Imthiyaz at Sun City Travels in Colombo and he got us a very good rate for our stay. We would like to thank all the staff for their fantastic efforts in making our holiday so amazing. My daughter says she would give the hotel 10 stars if she was allowed. We look forward to returning in 2014. Hector, Maria and Kandy Baker.

text: This is meant to be a 5 star hotel, but is lacking in so many areas. The positives first. The restaurant staff and room cleaning staff were excellent. The rooms are very nice, spacious and beds are extremely comfortable. Unfortunately the reception staff and management were extremely unhelpful and didnâ€™t address issues when highlighted. We visited during Sri Lankan new year and we knew shops and restaurants would be closed, we asked the reception staff and were advised Fri and sat (which is what we expected) I also asked if they knew if restaurants in Galle would be open on the Sunday and was advised they would all be closed as still new year so better to stay at the hotel. This was incorrect as a discovered through a Facebook forum and visited Galle on the Sunday were all restaurants were open. This felt like an attempt to keep you in the hotel spending money. The prices at the hotel were also questionable. The hotel we stayed in the week before had clear pricing on there menu eg Nani goreng 1800 Sri Lankan rupees. The heritance menu do 10% state service charge to be added, but also to be added is 18% vat meaning the prices stated which were already at least 20% higher than the previous 5star rated hotel we had stayed in were much more costly than other similarly rated hotels and more concerningly this isnâ€™t clear. The pools open at 8am which is fine as they need to clean them, but the bed cover and towels arenâ€™t available until 8am and as I am an early riser and like to get up and spend some time in the sun before breakfast and the sun gets too hot this was disappointing. Also out of the 5 nights we stayed here I had to trek around the resort on 3 separate days to find a pool attendant as you canâ€™t get the mattress and towels yourself, having gone to reception on 2 occasions it took until 9 am on 2 of the days to get the towels and mattresses, and all the manager Clive could do was apologise, which given it happened again the following morning was very poor. The issue clearly hadnâ€™t been addressed. Also around the pool, wasnâ€™t cleaned with cigarette ends (dissapointing thatâ€™s scruffy guests leave this is the first place) plastic bottles and beer caps left on the grass for the last 4 days we were there. I would not recommend this hotel to stay at and instead would highly recommend the 5 star Taj Bentota which is only 20 minutes away and is excellent with much more around the hotel as well which if you want to explore is great.

text: I visited this hotel a couple of times & this is one place you should try for sure irrespective of whether you are a local or tourist. From the lobby itself you can feel the difference. True that there are many hotels with wonderful facilities...some might even have better facilities than here but the real factor that makes a difference here is the "people factor". The employees of this hotel made me & my team feel very special indeed. They have what I would call the personal touch which is the most important thing. I was truly amazed as to how far the General Manager,Residential Manager, Head Chef etc is willing to go to make us happy & make the visits simply perfect! If I were to commment about the faclities....lovely rooms...infinity pool...great restaurants...bar..sat TV....wifi....animators, DJs to facilitate groups....night club..beach view....etc..What more would one want? And also the food is worth every bit that you pay. The range they offer in their buffets is vast & delicious...it'll fit both young & old alike...I would recommend Heritance Ahungalla for a family\business trip without any reservations! Looking forward to my next visit there! Cheers!

However the staff were fantastic at dealing with this for me and I honestly couldnâ€™t have been in better hands. I really did appreciate their efforts in ensuring I ate a proper meal once they realised I was struggling. The pools were easily the best pools we had access to during our trip, we spent a lot more time using these facilities than we did anywhere else. One of the things I disliked was being shouted at from behind the chain link fence to come and see what the locals were selling but theyâ€™re not on hotel property so I understand there isnâ€™t anything staff can do about them. We were on our honeymoon and our tour operator had told us in our itinerary to bring our marriage certificate in order to receive honeymoon benefits. However when we checked in staff said it wasnâ€™t needed and didnâ€™t acknowledge it was our honeymoon at all.

Would not choose to return here unfortunately. Prefer Heritance Kandalama.

text: It was an overall disappointing stay at Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel was fully booked during our stay, given the holiday season. The hotel staff was very nice and friendly. It is an old building and definitely needs maintenance, particularly the rooms. For a 5-star property, the room is small, and the toilet hardly has any space in it, which is not what you'd expect given the star category this hotel boasts about and when compared to other similar 5-star hotels and resorts in Sri Lanka. The quality of the extra bed in the triple room would possibly befit a 2 or 3 star hotel. On the other hand, the king bed in the room was very comfortable, and one of the pluses was the sea view from the room, which was amazing. The food lacked variety and if you are a vegetarian, stay away from Heritance Ahungalla. They simply don't cater to those needs, even if you make a special note of it. The lunch buffet was the worst of the three meals we had. This was brought to the attention of the chef and the restaurant manager, and they were most apologetic, but it was an overall bitter experience in the end at Heritance Ahungalla. On the contrary, the desserts were superb and delicious. Overall, our stay did not offer any value for money, so I would never visit or recommend this hotel.

text: Though it's described as a five-star resort, my parents and I were sorely disappointed by this hotel and will not be returning. The cons: 1. The receptionist offered us the opportunity to upgrade to full-board or half-board at a discount (USD30 instead of USD25 per meal). When we asked which restaurants this was applicable for, they said that it was only for the main restaurant, but failed to mention that it was ONLY valid for the buffet. If we had known, we wouldn't have signed up for two days of buffet-only meals. We found out because the waiter told us we couldn't have ala carte, and all of this happened after we'd paid for half-board for two days. In addition to not being told exactly what we were paying for, we discovered that the buffer cost LKR3,700 (USD24.2). So you're telling me that I didn't receive a discount--I'm actually paying the full cost of the buffet AND I'm locked in for a two-day commitment. This was dishonest on the hotel's part, and according to our travel agent, they shouldn't be directly giving us discounts--they're supposed to go through the agent. All in all, very poor form on the hotel's part. 2. On the morning of our check-out date, my bathroom didn't have water. I couldn't use the sink, I couldn't shower; it's a good thing I didn't have to flush anything. I checked my dad's room next door - also no water. It took two calls for housekeeping for the water to come back. How is this acceptable? 3. Our room had an odd smell that came from the bathroom drain. When we told the GRO, she said housekeeping would be around shortly to attend to it. They arrived 18 hours later. 4. When we first arrived, there was no porter to be found and we waited a solid few minutes before the receptionist noticed that we wanted to check in with our bags. He then rushed out and seemed very frazzled. Out of the 7 hotels we stayed in Sri Lanka, this was by far the poorest reception we'd received. The pros: 1. The restaurant staff were lovely, warm and attentive. My mum had a broken arm on this trip and the chef himself came out and helped her take food for the buffet and then walked her to her table. 2. They provide comfortable flip flops for guests to use on the beach and around the property. 3. The food was delicious. Every dish we had was delicious--both Sri Lankan and international fare.

text: We stayed from 18 to 21 January with a group of 13 family members. This was the second hotel in the Heritance group we stayed at during our 23 day holiday in Sri Lanka. Compared to Heritance Kandalama Ahungalla was a real disappointment. It looks great when you first arrive - the pool looks fantastic but everything else about it was disappointing - the tiles in the foyer area and along the corridors are stained, the bathrooms need a really good scrub, the food in the buffets was boring and many of the staff looked like they just didn't want to be there. Overall there just didn't seem to be the attention to detail we saw at Kandalama - we booked 3 double rooms, 2 twins and one triple room. On arrival the 3 doubles were all made up as twins and the triple had only 2 beds. One of the couples called reception on arrival to have the beds remade as a a double and had no problems, the second called and was told that it was not their practice to do that and in order to have a double bed the couple would have to be moved and that couldn't happen at the time because the hotel was full, the third couple then rang and was upgraded to a better room, despite the previous couple being told that there were no other rooms at all. In the triple room a small fold out bed was provided and most of the first evening was spent trying to explain to the staff that the tiny bed was not large enough for a teenage boy. Eventually after much conversation a better bed was provided. My parents have visited this hotel 4 times, however I would not go there again. In its current condition it is not worth the price charged.

text: After a 6 hour drive we were welcomed to Heritance Ahungalla with a drink and fast check in and shown to our rooms. We were upgraded to a suite which was a nice surprise and invited to the managers cocktail party. The rooms were very spacious, quiet and clean with wonderful views over the ocean. The pools and grounds were immaculately kept with staff to help you move day beds, supply towels and tend to your every need. The food was great in the restaraunts, but very dissapointing room service and pool bar/ outdoor cafe food - the "hot" food always came out cold and the icecream was served melted and the staff were not that keen to fix it. We wre lucky enough to be invited in to the kitchen for special cooking lessons which were wonderful. I found this hotel to be a wonderful place to relax and unwind at the end of a busy holiday.

text: Checked into hotel Mid August into a luxury room and I would highly reccomend paying that little bit extra as the rooms are huge! And you get a bath tub that overlooks the pool.. but no one can see in as there is mesh stopping.. so its very private! On arrival sat down with a welcome drink (Pineapple or Wood Apple juice) as we came early from Colombo around 11am and room was not ready.. but that did not bother me as they advised full occupancy in hotel before we came and cannot get early check in which was ok because My partner and I sat in the bar and had a few drinks.. they came to us and gave the key instead of us going to reception.... Went to our room! and I thought it was very very clean.. the bed was so comfy... In the luxury rooms there is no ceiling fan tho, but you have an aircon which gets cool in the nights ... Room was cleaned every morning and evening.. fresh towels and bathrobes... Both pools were good but i prefered the private pool the best! & it had a spa you can use from certain hours and relaxing!! I used the Coco Spa and got a sweedish massage and it was the most relaxing thing, and was very professional as they drape you properly with the towels and do an amazing job.. they are Balinese ladies and very lovely and do a great job! My husband got one the following day! Food in the resturant was beautiful... you can get your Sri Lankan curries or you can get Bbq night.. prawns.. lots of salad to choose from... & soups.. my favourite was the deserts.. so lovely ... text: This magnificently designed hotel is a few hours north of Galle, on the sea. Like other great Sri Lankan hotels the foyer/reception area is open so there is a wonderful, gentle sea breeze cooling the reception area even on the hotest day. There are 2 separate pools, both clean, and beautifully maintained. There is a huge tree ocer one them providing natural shade. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The buffet is plentiful but you can also order a la carte in a separate area of the dining room. The breakfast is excellent - so many choices. I had the best omelette I had on my trip (and I a few good ones). As in other Heritance hotels in Sri Lanka, the staff are welcoming, polite and honest. You're on the beach - but you can't swim as there's a dangerous rip. But, oh well, the pool's pretty nice anyway. You can always go for a walk on the beach instead. It felt so luxurious and its actually very reasonably priced.

We were told the hotel was running full.So we would be given a room change the next day.It never happened.Quite disappointing. Even the service in the restaurant was appalling none of the waiters bother to even keep the cutlery on the table after we have taken out plates or serve us even drinking water we had to repeatedly request for it.Being a 5-star hotel we were surprised at the dismal service. I might not consider the property again solely for the lack of service. Also the restaurants lack a choice of vegetarian food. especially the fine dinning restaurants does not serve any vegetarian food. even on request.We we forced to use the buffet every time.Which also has limited options.Disappointed again. We would not recommend this to others.

text: Our stay was from 01st of April to the 02nd of April. As April was a month where a lot of tourists are attracted to Sri Lanka, the hotel did have a lot of guests. But the staff made sure that everyone was treated in a special way. The mastermind behind the architecture of Heritance Ahungalla is Late Geoffrey Bawa and as a result, itâ€™s one of the most striking resorts in the Sri Lankan coast. From the moment where you set foot in the hotel till you leave, the staff stays by your side making sure that your stay is memorable. We experienced a situation which made our visit unforgettable, on the 02nd of April. It was my daughterâ€™s birthday on the 02nd and on the previous day, Mr. Nipun Mawatta happened to know about it from a friendly talk with us. However that simple conversation was enough for him to alert the rest of the staff to surprise my daughter at breakfast on the 02nd by appearing suddenly with a trolley laden with balloons and a birthday cake with the restaurant crew coming together to sing happy birthday as she cut the cake. It was totally an unexpected, well-planned surprise and Mr. Mawatte and the staff deserves a shower of thanks. Not to forget, the food at Heritance was always â€œnever-enoughâ€ due to their taste and variety. The rooms were lavish and we highly recommend the rooms with the ocean view as it is truly amazing. The infinity pool is always inviting in the burning heat. During our stay, several gents in the staff decided to display their hidden talents from a hilarious performance after dinner. It kept everyone laughing every time we recalled it. Heritance Ahungalla is one of the greatest places to experience the beauty of the Sri Lankan coast and a place â€œWHERE TRADITION IS ALIVEâ€.

text: We arrived here nearly a week ago to torrential rain. This is the end of the monsoon season in this part of the island. First impressions of the hotel were lovely. The staff are what makes this hotel a pleasure to stay in. We were shown to our room which was a little dated but clean and cool. The rain Showers in the room are great and the shower gel smells of a tropical fruit sensation. Food here is amazing. The head chef Manjua runs a great team of chefs who are more than happy to cook you what you like if what's on offer isn't to your taste. They sure know how to make curries here. You must try every single one as they are divine. Our ever expanding waistlines are proof of this. There is plenty more on offer if curries are not your thing. A myriad of fresh fruit is available and bananas taste amazing, nothing like what we eat at home. The weather was good most days. Towards the early evening rain clouds gather and a heavy downpour follows. Perfect time for a G&T at the pool bar. Sunsets are incredible and worth waiting around to see. The beach is vast and deserted. Just a few hotel guests walking along taking in it beauty. There are however beach guys who nag the pants off you to sell you sightseeing trips. Be aware they usually don't have insurance so best to book with a reputable company. They are harmless just a few no thank you and they get the message. There are a group of ladies who sell sarongs and trinkets on the beach they are lovely and friendly, don't forget to barter here, start low and then usually meet in the middle. Be careful of the sun you burn very quickly and don't forget mozzie repellant and bite cream. We used a guide for our trips LASI TOURS LASI was great and drove safely through the traffic which is another world in itself. He is very knowledgable and will arrange bespoke tours according to your needs. Sri Lanka is beautiful. Made even more special by its people. The temples, turtle sanctuaries, elephant retreats are fab. Unfortunately we didn't have enough time to see everything so a revisit will be on the cards. I hope you find this review of interest

text: This hotel was the first destination of our honeymoon. The cool and calm environment that one encounters as you drive through the gates up to the reception is certainly inviting and to say that reflects the hotel's outlook would be an understatement. The check in was breezy with a warm welcoming service by the front office staff - now that's what I call hospitality. Although the room we got was located in the far corner, the room condition and facilities were simply breathtaking. The snacks provided were somewhat overwhelming but they tasted so well, that one would be stupid to resist. The Jacuzzi was a mind-blowing experience. As for the hotel service, I simply don't know how they do it, but they will be there at your doorstep literally seconds after you keep the phone. The restaurant and its management have won many accolades which they proudly display at the entrance. It was not before long that we realised why they receive them. The food is simply amazing with an endless spread. To walk around and have a look alone can fill you up. The flavours blend so well and they know how to exert the correct balance of tastes especially in local cuisines. The action stations were constantly full of action with a variety from prawns, sausages, bacon and waffles steaming continuously. Despite serious time restrictions and a house full of guests, the staff will go the extra mile just to see that smile on your face. The weekend extravaganza is something that one should not miss. On Fridays and Saturdays, the hotel features a cultural extravaganza with traditional and contemporary performances including the occasional fire limbo. Simply worth the time. The locality of the area features picteresque river boat rides to which the hotel also has some arrangements at additional cost. We could not make this journey, but previous experiences suggest that this cannot fail. The only option for improvement that I could think for the hotel is that it shows no signage for anyone plying from the South towards it. Whilst motorists from Colombo along the Galle Road (A2) would not miss the hotel sign, we travelled along the expressway (E1) to come up from south. Nearly missed the turn but managed not to overshoot it too much thanks to some roadside assistance. All in all, this was the first destination upon entering matrimony, and the warm service and comfortable outing at Heritance Ahungalla will be etched in our memories forever. A surefire revisiting option for us.
cleaned_text: this hotel wa the first destination of our honeymoon the cool and calm environment that one encounter a you drive through the gate up to the reception is certainly inviting and to say that reflects the hotel outlook would be an understatement the check in wa breezy with a warm welcoming service by the front office staff now thats what i call hospitality although the room we got wa located in the far corner the room condition and facility were simply breathtaking the snack provided were somewhat overwhelming but they tasted so well that one would be stupid to resist the jacuzzi wa a mindblowing experience a for the hotel service i simply dont know how they do it but they will be there at your doorstep literally second after you keep the phone the restaurant and it management have won many accolade which they proudly display at the entrance it wa not before long that we realised why they receive them the food is simply amazing with an endless spread to walk around and have a look alone can fill you up the flavour blend so well and they know how to exert the correct balance of taste especially in local cuisine the action station were constantly full of action with a variety from prawn sausage bacon and waffle steaming continuously despite serious time restriction and a house full of guest the staff will go the extra mile just to see that smile on your face the weekend extravaganza is something that one should not miss on friday and saturday the hotel feature a cultural extravaganza with traditional and contemporary performance including the occasional fire limbo simply worth the time the locality of the area feature picteresque river boat ride to which the hotel also ha some arrangement at additional cost we could not make this journey but previous experience suggest that this can not fail the only option for improvement that i could think for the hotel is that it show no signage for anyone plying from the south towards it whilst motorist from colombo along the galle road a would not miss the hotel sign we travelled along the expressway e to come up from south nearly missed the turn but managed not to overshoot it too much thanks to some roadside assistance all in all this wa the first destination upon entering matrimony and the warm service and comfortable outing at heritance ahungalla will be etched in our memory forever a surefire revisiting option for u

text: When we hear the name Heritance of Aitken Spence, we usually consider it to be one of the most exciting stays. But unfortunately it is a shame to the so called brand Heritance and as well as for the Aitken Spence. We went there for our annual gathering of my workplace and we have reserved about 19 rooms for the last weekend. please find the following: Welcome: They have warmly welcomed us and given the rooms on time. It is appreciated since we got the rooms just within half an hour. Rooms: The room given to me and my wife was on the third floor. Right at the moment we stepped in to the room we felt that it was not cleaned properly. Basically it was not swept at all for weeks as we felt. We were not even provided with the bathrobes to the rooms. Further, only two towels were available at the room and not even the face towels were placed. Bathroom amenities were so old and an immediate renovation should be taken place. One of the Tea/Coffee mugs in the room was not washed (Pictures attached). Buffet: Only one restaurant in operation or only one restaurant is available. It was totally crowded. Dinner on 26th Sept 2020: Restaurant was fully crowded. They do not provide at least the enough seating capacity for the guests. If I'm not mistaken, there were two other groups checked-in to the hotel during that day. However they have arranged some tables outside the restaurant where they were not attended by a single restaurant staff member just to refill their water goblets. Food was totally bad and had a very bad experience with the so called Sri Lankan Chicken Kottu Roti. It was totally frozen andwas not tasty at all. I have complained but the only answer I got from the so called F&B Manager or the Guest Services Representative was 'Will inform and will check with the chef'. Is that an answer from a so called hotel chain like Heritance by Aitken Spence??? Restaurant staff were not capable of attending to the guests and could not even clean the buffet frequently. Please find the attached pictures of the Ice Cream corner. Breakfast on 27th Sept 2020: Compared to the dinner on previous night, this was slightly okay. But they failed arrange the seating for the whole set of occupents. Lunch on 27th Sept 2020: Again it was horrible and had nothing to eat at all. We went for lunch around 1.30pm and even on that time they are out of some food. They had a bowl with a name tag 'Chicken Sausages' and only a half of a sausage is left. When I asked for 4 sausages to me & my wife, the guy came and noted our table and promised to bring them to our table. But unfortunately I couldn't see him afterwards. When it comes to desserts corner, there were nithing to eat at all and please refer the pictures attached. No more refilling or serving and the time was 2.35pm. Premises: There was a very bad smell in the whole hotel from the evening to the noon of the next day. When inquired, they said it is from the sea. But please note that this is not the only hotel we visted in the sea side and we have no any kind of an experience from the rest of the hotels we visited. I have never being to a Heritance Hotel before and I hope that the rest of the Heritance hotels would not be like this. Personally, I'm so disappointed with the hotel and I didn't expect this kind of a service and an experience from you guys. Lack of staff, does not mean that you are free from providing the five star hospitality. If you don't have the sufficient staff, please do not accept so much of bookings for a day. In my opinion, you should pay more attention to the above in order to provide a better experience to the people who visit Heritance Ahungalla. Further, especially in this period, you all are surviving just because of the locals. I'm truly disappointed and also feel very sad. By the way, Good Luck!

text: Overnight on tour. They said it was five stars, but there was no toothbrush or slippers. Shampoo is contained in a ceramic container, making it difficult to use. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, the location is great! The food buffet is not so different from other hotels. The staff are kind. Finally, after I went on a hotel tour, they took my phone away from me because it was a survey. I logged into Google without permission and the hotel staff ticked all the good ratings. The receptionist female staff had asked us to only include comments, but the male staff were surprised when they closed the box and returned without comment after checking all the good boxes. It was an incident that made me think you didn't know what you were doing or you were mocking me.

text: We just got back from Ahungalla one of 3 hotels we stayed at in Sri Lanka, we spent the first few days of our holiday travelling around and then 4 nights here. Quite frankly I cannot believe the rubbish some nit pickers write on here. The hotel is amazing, the setting is gorgeous and the staff are the friendliest we met. All the staff are very well trained and could not help us enough very approachable. The room was clean and kept clean daily by housekeeping who did an outstanding job. The A/C worked wonders and our room was a constant cool haven from the outside temperatures. We were on a half board basis and ate every day at the resturant. I found the variety good and my husband enjoyed all the local dishes, even on a day when i couldnt find a meal to my taste the kitchen prepared me something just for me. We were completely content in the hotel and only left once for a small shopping trip. I haved stayed in a variety of hotels in other countried but this was my first time to Sri Lanka, I was unsure what to expect but was completely happy with my hotel choices and the country a fab holiday.

text: I used to be a frequent guest since early 2009. This hotel used to be one of the best in every possible way. I should say that the location is great, with absolutely stunning views of the southern beaches of Sri Lanka. The architecture, flora and fauna gives a very relaxing feeling away from the commercial/business feeling. The staff is still very helpful, most would bed over back to entertain the guests. During the last visit with my wife they even upgraded me to their best suite, the Sachin Tendulkar Suite with no buzz or hazel at all. I must say, the rooms are of good size. But unfortunately that is where it ends! The buffets are not up to the standards ( I am being very polite and generous towards the hotel here). Variety is lacking, taste is lacking, freshness is lacking. The edible items run over in 1 hour, so if you go there it late - you are left to trial the buns and sandwiches like parchment, and some left over stuff. As with many other hotels in SL they seem to cater a specific corporate client base, as a result the food spoils it for the relaxing holiday traveller. This is not just one time experience, but my observations over time. Restaurants and ala carte has little to offer. The "best suite" feels like collapsing on one end, not cleaned for days on another note, and worse of all even the renovation seems to be left at half way. Little activities happening at night, and the management does not seem to be interested in addressing it for years. Last few visits all I felt is that the staff at junior positions, room services, and reception are trying to blow some warmth and energy into it, but the higher levels seem to be not bothered about what they offer to the clients. While I do believe, looking at the number of corporate customers in the restaurant (mainly East Asian and Indian - whom I have randomly come to contact with, have informed me that they are sent to this place via corporate arrangements, not by choice) that the hotel is likely making good returns and is not financially pressured to invest in restructuring and renovation; it makes me sad that this is like an aincient giant which is approaching its last legs. Would I recommend it to anyone? Probably not if you are on your vacation. Given there are quite nice new boutique hotels in the area, for a fraction higher price point. Would I go there again? Probably not, unless the hotel addresses these issues effectively, because it's a waste of time and money the way it is.

text: Apologies ! This should have been written a while ago. By no means does the below completely under rate our experience, but hopefully the feedback will be taken as useful, with both the good and bad. The Bad: Having to change rooms the last 2 days, due to water heating and aircon issues. Lack of food options when less guests (totally understandable but still a shame, especially at breakfeast). Wear and tear is visible, a renovation would be a great bonus. But it by no means spoilt our trip, just an observation. Alot of mould in the bathrooms, requires some attention. I know it's a beach resort but the build up can get a little much. Due to choosing "all inclusive" option, the cocktails are very limited. Are nice but limited. I think if I went next time I would not do all inclusive, purely so we could enjoy a bit more diverse range. Snack foods however, (I recomend the fish and chips!) are lovely ! Due to post covid, lack of features and actitives are limited (again understandable, but needs mentioning prior to booking). Examples, Bicycle rentals, Spas, nightclub etc. Also the build up on rubbish on the shores, but again was due to time of the year with the seas as well. The Weird: The constant hello from a lady passing the perimeter of the hotel nearly every day trying to sell something. A Foreign guest who seems to be treated like royalty & known by all staff (Hi Aiya?!), I know there are less guests, but 3 beds, 6 cushions and 6 towels (with change every few hrs) for 2 people is a bit much... Also witnessed the attempt of trying to give chocolates to everyone including children (other guests) seemed a bit weird, maybe their form of a Santa? The repetiveness of the music in the restaurant and the bar, please I would advise working on changing this ! Or atleast having a different playlist alternating every other day ! If I heard John Lenon's Yesterday instrumental one more time... !! And the rest of Good ! (a lot more) : Firstly, the highest points go to the the staff and service, truely everyone that worked there were such amazing human beings, and we were humbled to have stayed at the resort with them ! Their commitment and attentivness was visible throughout our stay, so thank you very much to all of you. Cleaners : Nearly every day not only were the rooms tidied, but we were left with decorative and hilarious towel arrangements ! Kudos to the creativity ! Shout out to Dukmal and his colleagues for this ! I wish you all the best sir. Front of house & general assitance : Welcomed from the first minute by all and every request and detail asked was attented to. Samith whom we were greeted every day by and was checked in on was a great help & very friendly, even arranged a tour to the Safari for us and breakfasts to take was ensured. Sorry we missed saying good bye to you ! Hope to see you again. Restaurant: Lilanga, a gentlemen in charge of the restaurant, with a wealth of knowledge and tries to cater to all your needs . If you ever feel a meal is not right or if you need something, do reach out to him and he will help you, Thanks again ! A big gratitude to Jananjaya, whom we felt looked after us so much every day. Whom we grew to bond with, it was a pleasure meeting you ! Other names to mention, and sorry for not remembering all ! Tony, Panditha, Chamila as well, and also the lovely ladies who always greeted us and sat us down to our tables for every service. Bar: Much thanks to Calinga ! Thank you for all the cocktails. And again others who served us at the bar ! Pool: Both guys we had were amazing and made sure we always had towels, and cushion for the sunbeds. Dinesh, very nice to meet you and always laughing and joking made us so much more at ease. And last but not least, although I dont have names to mention. Many thanks to the security guards who would tend to go unnoticed, but honestly they made us feel safe and secure always seeing them around. The location, on the beach front, shame about the rough seas, cannot wait to see what it is like when the seas are calm ! With the infinity pool in the main area, it felt like you were in the sea anyway ! The food selection, although sometimes smaller, sometimes bigger. Always had a good variety for most days, and was always very tasty, and fresh. As one can expect, spices are prevalent but again requests can be made to amend this. There is alot of western options to accomodate. Again a shout out to Tony whom after talking about the fact that we never saw any Kottu on the buffet, was then on the main Buffet stand the next day being enjoyed not only by our selves but all other guests ! Buffer / BBQs on the outside garden is alway also a great addition when they can accomodate this ! The peacefulness. I think due to the post covid situation, we had the best of both worlds in a sense. Weekdays we pretty much had the pools to ourselves, and the weekends more locals arrived and so the resort was busier. As much as the peacefulness was appreciated, hopefully in the future, more "animations /activies" & I would look to see all bars in full operation, can be achieved to change the days up a bit. The wildlife, Birds, Iguanas, lizards, monkeys. Nothing disturbing but made it so much more tranquil with the plantation as well being among all of this. Not to mention the few dogs and cats. If you like plantation indoors as well, then you will enjoy the rooms and hotel itself as well, at night time they look even better if the lights are working. We stayed at Heritance 15th to the 27th. And really hope to visit another time in the near future !

text: We decided to stay at Heritance Ahungalla during our recent trip to Sri Lanka for two reasons... 1. The taj At bentota was under renovation and 2. People generally had good things to say about it. However our experience was OK. Rooms- they are clean, decent size, comfortable beds...but they were somehow a little dull.. Otherwise the rooms were quite clean and the housekeeping generally was good. We had a beautiful view of the sea from the room Food was expensive in the fine dining restaurants.. Buffet and coffee shop were ok though. We didn't quite like the dinner buffet, the breakfast buffet was decent. Overall hotel is ok. When you enter the lobby you don't feel that this is a luxury property. Though it's clean it's really minimalistic. They say it's the geoffery bawa minimalistic design and I personally prefer less to more but This place was actually quite bare. The pool however is very picturesque,,,and very clean. The main disappointment however was the beach. The beach actually was ok .. clean and all but the ocean floor was not a gentle sloping floor like in bentota near taj. It's some thing like it will be 3 feet deep ten feet from the beach and then 1 foot deep when you go further. S it was quite scary for a non swimmer like me as I was not prepared for the sudden drop in the ocean floor. The service overall was good and very courteous. However, the fact that the housekeeping staff barges into your room once u call for a check out was something I Didn't appreciate and thought it was very rude. They knock once and use their key to enter to check the minibar. They don't hv the decency to wait till we open the door or ask them to come in. The other staff was very good. There were a lot of children at the resort and the staff was very patient with all the kids who were almost wrecking their Christmas trees and running around the buffet place like crazy

text: Our problem started upon our arrival when we were told that we had been upgraded to a luxury room, but it turned out to be an isolated one (at the very end of the hotel) with a view on tennis courts. In addition, the room contained only 2 beds (One queen-sized and another â€œExtraâ€ bed). As we had explicitly requested (and confirmed twice with our travel agent) a room with 3 beds and a sea view, we made this clear to the staff member who showed us the room. After she spent some time on the phone, she referred us to the manager on duty( Srinath A ). This manager was beyond rude and impatient, immediately telling us that there were no other rooms available for us to change, because apparently we had checked in late (6 pm). Brushing aside this unprofessionalism, we peacefully requested a refund, in order to be available to switch hotels and find what we are looking for elsewhere. At this point, the manager refused and defiantly told us: â€œWe donâ€™t have money at the hotel. Talk to your travel agent to get money, and go''. After spending 3 hours in the lobby and threatening to escalate if we were not refunded our money right away, suddenly and magically, a suite became available for us to move into, which uncovered the lies that were being told before about the hotel being fully-booked. Such dishonesty and disrespect is not worthy of a 5-star hotel.

text: Was here on a two night trip with the rest of my colleagues from office. Really not much to write home about. It didn't stand up to my expectations of a five star hotel. The staff was very courteous and helpful. There is no argument about that but the hotel infrastructure wasn't exactly that great. The car parks are somewhere way away that you have to rely on valet parking. This means you have to pick up every single thing you need from the vehicle before you check-in. The dining halls are pretty dark and gloomy, mostly I believe due to the dark colouring of the ceiling which is decorated with batik. The buffet area was really odd, it was almost like walking in to someone's kitchen to get the food served, the dining hall and the buffet area have very different vibes. The pool is good and well maintained and they do have some activity rooms where you could play 8-ball or carrom or chess. But the overall set up just put me off. Will not be returning here.

text: We stayed at this hotel for the first time back in the late 90s, when it was called Triton. By the way, the statue of this Triton still flaunts at the entrance. It was a marvelous, respectable hotel with several restaurants, a tea room, fine service, and two lovely swimming pools. This is a beautiful colonial-style building, inside there are very beautiful galleries, between which water flows, trees and flowers grow. This is real architecture, not a soulless block with rooms. Unfortunately, the hotel ended up under water in December, 2004. The staff will tell you that only the first floor was flooded, and they will lie. Typical tsunami traces will also be on the third floor, this can be seen, although the walls are being tinted. I don't really understand how they got 5 stars. It is a very sad sight of destruction and extinction. The hotel is a pity as an old horse, from which they are trying to squeeze out the remnants of strength. Unmown grass, peeling sun loungers, frayed beach towels, yellowed bath towels, stained old linen, squeaky air conditioner, mildew, dampness, musty. Tiles are falling off in pools. Fence-mesh around the perimeter. And that is not all. This once beautiful hotel is now used as a staging post for bus groups, arriving to spend one night before departure. From the pros: It is still an outwardly beautiful building The staff works with full dedication Decent cuisine for Europeans, not too spicy, many adapted dishes. In the room, like more than 20 years ago, a bowl of fresh seasonal fruits will be waiting for you. The staff is still on the ball.

text: Our first stay here in 2009 was on the very strong recommendation of Sri Lankan friends and we vowed to return sooner rather than later. Neither my wife or I recognised some of the negative comments on this site prior to booking our latest trip in December 2011 but we had some concerns. Those concerns were totally unfounded. From the moment we were met with refreshing cinnamon tea until the redoubtable Dudley packed our cases in the car at the end of our stay, it was total relaxation. The attitude of the staff is a delight and may explain some of the complaints - they have a wonderful ability of being remarkably attentive whilst appearing to be laid back which may be misinterpreted as appearing not to care.Nothing could be further from the truth. Some of the younger staff members are still extremely keen and their enthusiasm, whilst appreciated, intrudes slightly into the relaxed ambiance. They could do well to learn from Jacob. If you have the good fortune to have your table served by this gentleman you will understand the point I'm attempting to make. He is like a swan gliding serenely on the surface whilst away from view he is paddling like hell to ensure that you enjoy every minute in his care. Our room was excellent - the only criticism we could make was the that the Venetian blind in the bathroom was past its best.... this is really struggling to be negative. I can't believe that someone on here had complained about the food - how absurd! Not only was the buffet absolutely first class but the puddings were out of this world. A real trip down memory lane for persons of a certain age! Unsurprisingly, the dessert table won first prize in the hotel industry awards. Please don't take my word for this - our visit coincided with that of an annual trip of French gamblers(???!) to the hotel. They attacked each meal with that Gallic gusto which is unique, (complete with napkins tied around their necks!) - if it hadn't been up to standard I'm sure that it would have been the kitchen staff at risk rather than the food! When these lovely characters found that my wife was multi-lingual they hijacked her on a regular basis to tell the hotel chefs of their appreciation. Another negative comment I had read was regarding the beach folk. Yes, at times they can be boorish but they are trying to make a living. If you inform them that you are definitely not interested in purchasing anything today they will leave you alone. You are, however, missing the opportunity to chat to some fascinating people with experiences completely different to your own who would really appreciate the opportunity of honing their language skills on you - this is especially true of the clothing ladies. If all else fails the magic word to use is 'yanda!' whose interpretation is, I believe as rude as it is effective! We would like to thank the management team of Rifan (General Manager), Tilleth (Food and Beverage Manager) and above all the professional and gregarious Sampath (Assistant Manager) for a superb stay. You have staff and a hotel to be very proud of.

text: Originally designed by Geoffery Bawa this is a hotel with impact. Beautiful pool areas and superb setting. The staff are always polite and friendly - always ready with a smile and going out of their way to assist. When booking a room be sure to state if you want a double rather than a twin. This hotel codes 'double' as twin beds positioned next to each other. So for a shared bed you need to request a 'king size' upon booking. A small irritating change of descriptor that lead to many a confusion and many a room change request I'm sure. The rooms are of a good size with brilliant en suites - great power showers. We had a large balcony - more of a terrace which was perfect for a g&t as the sun went down. We were on an all-inclusive package eating from the main restaurant each meal whilst in the hotel. Whilst I am never a fan of buffet style dining the quality and range of good was astounding. Always a fab selection of salads and local fruits as well as everything in between. We sampled do many new local dishes - one chef even cooking a new dish to try especially for me! If however it's Mediterranean/English fare you fancy whilst in the tropics, well then too you will not be disappointed. There were always about eight non-local dishes and about the same of Sri Lankan. Plus - if you're still peckish - a dizzying array of desserts. We arrived out of school holiday season and both pools were perfect for working off all that food, or pootling about in. On the last days of our stay however considerably more families arrived which made the pools, whilst beautiful, a little impractical for a full hotel. Whilst Western standard five star this certainly is not, overall it's a fine all inclusive offering.

text: Nice hotel but let down by a couple of things. Some of the staff are lovely but.... My daughter's favourite Jack Wills t-shirt went missing - one she wore to sleep in, so she never took it out of the room. The hotel staff are very hungry for tips (one waiter told me within a minute of meeting that he was the sole breadwinner for his family and he only earned 4,000 rupees a month). It gets oppressive. The cleaners come into your room (both sets, am and pm) and tell you they are the only person responsible for cleaning your room (and can I have a tip please! ). We were given only one mug, and there were a lot of mosquitos in the room. The toiletries are in refillable china containers and its impossible to get anything out of them. Food is very good but lunches and drinks very expensive. Gave us a lovely christmas eve meal and went to great efforts (ice sculptures and father christmas arriving in a boat.) Waited for ever for coffee in the morning. Not much to do when it rains and the water was too rough to go in the sea, plus you get hassled and followed on the beach. Could be so much better.
