text: This is our 8th visit to Heritance Ahungalla. We are returning visitors every year as we are extremely pleased with the highest quality of service we have received and this has been consistent throughout all our stays. We are frequent travellers having stayed at many 5 stars hotels around the world, but this hotel has been outstanding and hence our return here each year. We would also like to thank the GM, the front office manager Indika and all the front office staff and special thanks to Chathuranga who organised kite flying for our 2 children. The food at this hotel is beyond words, it really is amazing. Compliments to the great chefs, Dimuthu Kumarasinghe and junior chef Dayananda. The chefs have recently won awards and we can totally agree that these awards are very well deserved. The hotel restaurant service is excellent and special thanks go to Mr Gamini and Thushara. Special thanks also go to Chamith and Raju the 2 Animation staff who entertained us with a variety of sports and activities for our children. Chamith and Raju are an asset to this hotel, they are both hard working with great personalities. The rooms we have had have always been super clean and spacious. The 2 swimming pools are both really big and always clean with excellent pool staff with great service. Thank you Heritance Ahungalla for a wonderful holiday. See you next year! Regards from Dr Jayasuriya and family

text: We travelled to this hotel with Kuoni travel under the idea that it was a 5* luxury hotel. This hotel had all the potential of a good 4* hotel. The beech was amazing the staff were amazing, however there always seemed to be something missing and not quality about the hotel. We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights having travelled around the island for 4-5 days. The poolside service was very good with staff being extremely friendly and chatty. The animator was also a healthy addition to the hotel encouraging water polo and other activates throughout the day. The pool bar offered a nice little lunchtime snack menu however every meal was with French fries and wasnâ€™t the best quality. We recommend sprite as it was half the price of coke or diet coke. The sprite was around 70p and coke was Â£1.50 for a can. There was also a service charge on each bill so there was no need for tipping and carrying cash as it could all be charged to the room The evening food in the main restaurant under a set menu was very average and was trying to be to clever for its own good. Not much variety if you were a fussy eater and didnâ€™t like fish. The al a carte restaurant (or coffee shop) offered a welcome opportunity to get a square meal. This was available with a 10% discount to half and full board customers. when the hotel got busy at the weekend however the restaurant came alive with a huge Mexican and bbq buffet on the Friday and Saturday nights. The breakfasts were also very good with every possible breakfast such as omelettes and waffles. However, when the weekend did arrive the hotel filled with hundreds of locals. This wasnt a problem until the quiet pool became a holiday at butlans with kids screaming and weeing into the pool. The locals were then extremely rude to the friendly staff making the stay extremely uncomfortable as you had to witness this behaviour. The staff were being shouted at and fingers clicked at with no manners. It was clear that the other guests felt the same through conversations in the lobby. The evening buffet at the weekend although it had good food resembled a school canteen. At 9 oclock families were bringing there young screaming children to dinner. Those children who were not dead on there feet at this time were runing around bumping in to the staff and other guests. This un civilised behaviour caused some couples to leave in disgust. The room was very good although we were continually being pested by staff asking if the room was ok. Also the wiring of the room was questionable with switches for different lights being in the wrong place. The beech was a no go area also as you were trying to have a romantic walk along the beech and were surrounded by peopel trying to sell you trips and clothing. Even when you were trying to sun bathe there was a constant noise coming from the beech of people trying to grab your attention. As a result of this I would not recommend this hotel to anyone I liked. I will also be informing Kuoni of the hotel at the weekend.

text: We visited Heritence Ahungalle for 2 nights in mid-April 2009. This was our second trip to the property having visited 5 years ago on our last trip to SL. Booked directly through the hotel website after comparing other similar properties such as Taj Exotica Bentota, The Fortress, Galle Fort Hotel and Eden Resort. Chose the Heritence given we had a wonderful stay 5 years ago. I wrote to the hotel inquiring about rates and was promised a free upgrade to a luxury room given that I was a returning guest. The hotel also stated that the property has been completely refurbished hence the drastic increase in price. When I got to the Heritence, I was told I would be given a deluxe room (the most basic room). I advised that I was promised a free upgrade to which I was told that they cannot honour this promise. They then advised that I could have an upgrade to a luxury room for an additional cost of Rs. 10,000 (US$86) per night. Given the higher cost I declined the upgrade and was quite disappointed. I had also requested a cot for my infant son when the booking was made. When I got to the hotel I was told that all the cots were in use. I complained to the General Manager who promised to look into it and get back to me, which he never did. We could not notice the refurbishments made to the property. The room we had looked very similar to the room we had five years ago as did the common areas. The property itself is beautifully maintained and is set on a stunning section of beach in SL. The main infinity pool and lobby area are very beautiful. The food is exceptional with a wide variety of choice all of which are of a very high level of quality. We visited this hotel during the Sri Lankan New Year and the hotel was full of local guests. We were blown away by the property and service on our last visit and were disappointed in the level of service during this trip (the GM has changed once during the past 5 years). I would say that we did have a good time and enjoyed the pool but would not likely return on our next trip to SL given they did not follow through on their promises.

text: Years ago this was probably a very grand hotel, however the grandeur has faded. The location & facilities appear very good, however the devil is in the detail and the lack of cleanliness makes the whole place feel grubby. I have stayed at numerous 5 star hotels around the world and have seen how standards vary in each continent. So using a European standard I would only rate this 3 star, which might meet some guests expectations. The staff are very friendly and energetic as we have experienced in all seven hotels during our two week Secrete Escapes tour. What this hotel lacks is Management direction to fix the cleanliness issues. As an example I enclose pictures of our recently renovated room where staff regularly create â€œtowel animalsâ€ when they should be directed to scrub mould of the newly tiled bathroom walls & floors.

text: We stayed beginning of August for 3 nights in the Junior Suite in Heritance Ahungalla. In general, the rooms are clean, the swimming pool is nice, especially for kids and also the beach is great. Unfortunately, like most 5-star hotels in Sri Lanka, also this one lacked essential things like a proper finishing in the room (the bathroom was a desaster, I cut myself several times at the glass door there), a very small TV only etc. The food was good quality, thoug a little expensive, but because we liked it we only ate at the hotel. The breakfast had a wide selection, and there was a big variety at the dinner buffetts, for example "seafood grill night" etc. The service was very poor, anything you wanted to do or to get took ages and did not work properly. On one saturday night there was a wedding with extremely loud music next to the second pool (where all the suites are localed; it was like a disco), and with still going on after 11 oÂ´clock and the kids not being able to sleep I complained several times without success. It went on until 3 in the morning, which literally destroyed our next day and is something no 5-star hotel should accept. Many guests complained, but the management rather preferred to cash in the money for the ceremony instead of satisfiying their guests. Nevertheless we had altogether a good time, the animateurs at the hotel were dedicated and we had a lot of fun with waterpolo and beach volleyball. One last note: as generally in Sri Lankan 5 star hotels, they overprice taxis etc. by 300 to 400%. Just go out of the hotel and rent a taxi or tuc-tuc there, as next to the savings the locals know all the places to go.

text: Disappointing Dining Experience at Ahungalla Heritance I had high expectations when visiting Ahungalla Heritance (part of the Aitken Spence chain), but the food quality was a major disappointment. The lunch buffet was underwhelming, with most dishes lacking salt and flavor. The fried rice, made with samba rice, was a poor choice and didnâ€™t complement the rest of the dishes at all. Tea-time snacks were no betterâ€”minimal variety and nothing appetizing or memorable. We even raised our concerns with the chefs, but unfortunately, there was no noticeable improvement. For a reputed hotel chain, the dining experience was far below standard. I hope the management takes this feedback seriously and works on upgrading their food quality and variety.

text: I planned a day out two weeks ago and requested details from the Hotel. I got the confirmation on 10 Feb with the reservation number. Representative from the hotel called me and confirmed my booking also. When We went to the hotel, the front office said they could not give us a room since hotel is fully occupied and they give the rooms for the day use on availability basis(not informed at the time of booking). However, they agreed to give us a changing room (B Grade room as per the front office) on FOC basis and we said ok since we traveled 2 hours from Colombo to Ahungalla. However, we didn't get the changing room also which was agreed to give within 10 minutes. We were there for about 1 hour and we cancelled our day out and came back to Colombo. At that time the front office staff asked the confirmation number and he said the booking was in the system. :( I don't about the process of Heritance Ahungalla, but this was my experience with this Hotel.

text: We checked into the hotel on Sunday a day before a public and bank holiday after the security checking we seated in the lobby for nearly 1/2 hrs and there were no welcome drink no wet towers Following day we saw the cart is serving the guests. Hotel was very crowded and we feel that not enough staff members attend for guests .Huge crowd for lunch dinner and breakfast and we had to come late for all 3 meals . Food was good but less varieties. No entertainment only 2 pics band was playing in the lobby and that also stopped at 11 p.m. due to restrictions , We feel that hotel should give more priority to its in house guests . Rooms are good and clean. The pool was very nice and refreshing. This hotel can be maintained better compared to what we witnessed.

text: The hotel decor is a little stark and requires a makeover - with the corridors resembling a hospital ward - a few pictures would liven the place up a bit. That said we ate at the Bar Restaurant and the food was very good. the hotel pools were enjoyable - but the seclusion was spoiled as the beach was intersected from the hotel grounds by a number of hawkers - who were polite enough but incessant. The beach was lovely - and we even witnessed a giant turtle arriving on shore in teh afternoon to lay its eggs - amazing. All said - I expected more - and beware teh burning sun!

text: A hotel that has an impeccable service and warmth about it. From the time you enter to the time you leave the staff will make you feel so at home. Filled with smiles and excellent service 24/7. A wonderful atmosphere with an infinity pool to die for. However i would like to give some constuctive feedback to the hotel management with regard to food. As a five star resort i expected the food on weekdays to be what i would say awesome. But i was disappointed to see the buffet was average. It didnt make me say wow and the dishes were predictable each time i came to the buffet as i stayed 3 nights. I was surprised to hear the hotel has an award winning chef. However it did not reflect so with the cuisine. The silver food containers were very hard to open and close. The buffet should be more colorful and the dessert needs to have variety as i have experienced in other five star hotels in sri lanka. The hotel didnt have a tea/coffee buffet for the evening tea. (As advised by the staff when inquired). Other hotels provide these services for full board guests. The tea in the room is not that pleasant due to the creamer tasting weird with tea. So they need to have a tea corner as well. Next time i return to the hotel i wish see this as a five star hotel to its fullest and not only to the star count. Dinuk Weerasekara (Sri Lanka)

text: I visited Heritance Ahungalla first time 16 years ago and again 15 years ago (when it was still operated under the name Triton), so I was very excited to go back to the hotel to see if it still carried that adventurous atmosphere that it did 16 years ago. I was also vevry excited to see how they had renovated the hotel after the horrible tsunami that destroyed much of the hotel about 10 years ago. I remembered the hotel as a luxurious hotel with a very high standard both in the restaurant and in the small bars around the area where you could buy from a large snack menu. Many of these places were closed now to my disappointment. The hotel of course more or less looked the same and the beautiful architecture of Geoffrey Bawa - Sri Lankas world renowned architect - was of course still stunning. I should say that my previous visits was during the peak season in february where the weather on that part of the island is fantastic. This time I visited in october and we experienced several hours of heavy rain on several of the days we stayed there, and of course that adds to the experience and the atmosphere as they had to keep huge plastic curtains down at all times to keep the water from running into the reception area and the bar area. The hallways was flooded due to the heavy rain and the open design of the hotel so they had to keep staff constantly mopping up water and that was of course no fault of theirs. That's just how it is during this season. But something seemed changed. The hotel seemed to have lost that exclusivity that set it apart from other hotels in Ahugalla/Bentota region.15 years ago there were a wonderful atmosphere in the evenings with jazz band and dancing in the lounge next to the reception and pool area. This time around that was gone - much to our dismay. We also remembered that every afternoon there was a very nice complimentary afternoon tea with buttercake and scones that you could enjoy just next to the large pool but when we asked if they still had it noone even seemed to remember that they had it 15 years ago. We stayed in one of the huge suites with several rooms a seperate living room two bathrooms, a huge balcony overloooking the residents pool with a view of the ocean behind the row of palm trees along the coast line. I don't know if some of the changes to the design and decor was due to the tsunami 10 years ago (after I visited the last time), but I remembered the beautiful residents pool (the other pool that are closed to anyone but guests in the suites and rooms in the fine wing with ocean view, and it was originally made with the most beautiful dark blue tiles that made it one of the most beautiful pools I had ever seen. This time the tiles have been removed and the pool was just an ordinary pool with a normal lightblue surface on the sides and bottom and not made from tiles anymore, just like so many ordinary pools you see all over Sri Lanka. That was sad - I thought. I may have needed refurbishment or renovation but they should have stayed true to the original design with the beautiful dark blue tiles when repairing the pool instead of the cheaper solution, as this did something to make the place stand out in a way that it now doesn't anymore. They also had a wonderful original boat like the ones used by the original population in Sri Lanka that was a trademark of Triton (as it was once called) but they had done little to keep it maintained, so it had obviously deteriorated over the last decade so they hadn't saved it (unless of course it was taken by the tsunami ten years ago). To me it was just a little sad to se that on the patio where it was once standing proud in the middle of the large pool was now just an empty plate with nothing to decorate the otherwise elegant pool area around the public pool and bar area. Another thing that added to the impression they had lowered the standard since we last visited 15 years ago was the many families with screaming children running around the pool. 15 years ago there was a much more tranquil and serene atmosphere with adult guiests with a certain sense of etiquette, which includes preventing your children from running around the other quests at the pool and adressing strangers asking all sorts of questions instead of staying near their parents as they are supposed to when using the residents pool. What had since we last visited become a sad but necessary precaution was a several meters high fence between the hotel grounds and the beach where only a small opening heavily guarded by two guards at all times (day and night) was the only passage to the beach. In the old days one could just stroll down through the line of shady palm trees and reach the beach from anywhere along the hotel grounds. But it was obviously a necessary precaution as we could see that many more touts and beggars and people selling all sorts of ridiculous junk and overpriced sarons, were all over the beach. It even seemed to us as if some of these local hustlers had some corrupt arrangement with some of the guards as they sometimes happened to be inside the fence (which means they have passed the guards unattended), and even when guards saw them on hotel grounds contacting the guests, they did absolutely nothing or very little to stop them from intimidating the guests and/or even excort them from the grounds, which would of course be their duty. One of the nights I stood in the dark on my balcony outside our suite and I noticed a visibly drunk guard who could hardly wallk in a straight line talking a little with himself while he suddenly stopped near the tennis court and fumbled with his trouser until he mannaged to unzip his pants in the middle of the lawn and urinate. That latter I could even live with - I'm no prude - had he just walked behind a tree and taken care of business, but I didn't find the fact that he was visibly drunk very reassuring. The folloing nights I stayed for an hour on my balcony to see if the guard from the night before would return, would return, but much to my surprise I saw something very strange occur. One of the guards (not the same as the drunk guard from yesterday) suddenly turned on his torch and he waved it up and down and from side to sight while pointing it in the direction towards the edge of the hotel grounds. Shortly thereafter I saw two locals walking past the tennis courts and sitting just below my balcony between the building/wing and the tennis court. They couldn't see me as I kept the balcony lights off as well as the lights in the livingroom so I was hidden in the dark. I looked in astonishment as these very suspicious looking local people arrived and they opened small packages and presented them on the top of low walll surrounding the terrace belonging to the suite just below ours and the guards looked at the "goods" in the beam of their flashlight at what looked like small packages of either pot or very small portions of khat to me (I've only seen khat but nevver tried it so it could be something else, but I know that khat is very poular if you have a job where it's hard to stay awake and it's popular amongst lorry drivers etc. so I could imagine that a boring night shift would also tempt someone to use khat to keep from falling asleep as it is a mild energy booster that make that kan keep you awake and alert) and khat is actually not amongst forbidden substances in all countries (at least not in Europe), so the use of khat may even be legal in Sri Lanka, that I don't know. Well, that aside, the guards clearly counted and exchanged money for these "goods" in the dim light from their torch. Suddenly one of the guards heard me making a noise as I was taking a step back and he pointed the torch directly at my face and for a short while I was blinded, and they saw me on the balcony, so he turned off the torch and they exchanged a few hasty words with the locals who then wrapped up the rest of their goods and ran away along the tennis court and disappeared in the dark. This was in no way frightening or intimidating, but it just seemed like something that wouldn't have happened at the classy and stylish Triton of the old days, and it only contributed to the vague feeling that the standard of the hotel was not quite the same as it was 15 years ago. From the experiences above one would have thought that it was a horrible experience, so why do I give it four stars after all? Because they still provide many of the things they provided in the old days. We always live in large suites when we travel, so I have a large backlog of experiences to use as comparison, and I must say that the suite was wonderful. It was clean and beautifully furnished and the large balcony streched all the way around the suite and had access doors from all rooms in the suite. I will also like to give the place the benefit of the doubt, because many things were closed - and that might be because it is the low season in october, so my final judgment should not be made until I've tried the place again in the high season between medio january until medio march where the weather in the southwest part of the coast line of Sri Lanka has the most beautiful weather. We also dined at the a la carte restaurant (not the large dining hall, but Restaurant Mustard at the terrace on the left side of the reception area just after the reception desk around the corner). The food was delicious, the service was perfect, and the setting was cozy with a dimly lit area and a very romantic atmosphere. So taht was truly perfect. The in-room dining (room service) was also very good and arrived quickly. The breakfast was wonderful and came on time every morning exactly at the time we've put on the breakfast list to hang on the door before going to sleep. The staff couldn't do a better job. They were quick, courteous, smiling, polite and they didn't hover at any time or made certain trick to earn extra tips (such as coming two persons to a one man job, or staying in the room and keep asking if everything is to our satisfaction, etc. - you know the drill). But none from the staff we met did that at any time. Of course my wife and I both agree on giving a generous tip at no less than 20% of the bill every time something is served, so we allso made it easy for the staff not to hover, and that should perhaps be taken into consideration, but we also find that people in Sri Lanka live on extremely low wages, and compared to the prices in Denmark where we live, even an additional 20% still makes for a very cheap price for people living in Europe, Australia and North America, so i cost us so little but means so much to them, so there is no need to be a miserly cheapskate. If you can afford an expensive plane ticket and to stay in a somewhat pricey hotel like this you probably can also survive giving 500-1000 Rps ($3-$6 USD) more when tipping the waiter, room boy, luggage carriers, drivers, etc. It takes so little and being generous when tipping often comes back a thousand fold throughout your stay when you are being served by the grateful, hard working, staff at the hotel, trying to accomodate even your most extravagant wishes and habits.(That's just my personal opinion on this subject, and each to their own, of course). I believe all rooms are non-smoking but most rooms are with a balcony (or a terrace if at ground level) so this is a comfortable hotel for smokers.

text: Room was average considering we had told them it was our honeymoon. Food was not up to par when comparing with other hotels in Sri Lanka until we spoke to one of the chefs who made us a traditional Sri Lankan curry and brought it to our table. Think they try to cater for far too many people instead of sticking to traditional dishes. We were told that it would be good for snorkelling but the sea is too rough all year round. Better snorkelling a few miles down the coast. Staff were useless at bringing drinks. Could take an awful long time waiting. We got bored with the bar and mundane entertainment and walked along the beach to a ramshackle hut called The Sunset Bar where we were given a warm welcome by the locals who run this place. Ending up dancing on the sand. Soooooooooooooooo much better than listening to polite, elevator music back at the hotel!! Wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone and wouldn't go back. There are much better hotels around.

text: I am writing this over a cup of coffee from the hotel. I have visited this hotel from the days it was triton and this officially concludes my 8th visit to this place (yes thats right !) And i am not joking ! Why so many times well two things always bring us back , one is the food and next is the service and fllexibilty. So this makes it my first visit for this year and believe or not i m due there in september as well. Over the years this hotel was able keep up as one of the trendiest in the vicinity however now it seems to lack behind. The food was once heavenly but now let me simply say " not as heavenly" . We were always amazed by the weekend dinner barbecue but this time it was highly dissapointimg and disorganised. We always loved the jumbo prawns and lobster (cray fish) that they always did have . but this time the stock seemed old and frozen . Worst of all the buffet spread never seemed to be re filled . Todays breakfast , i had to tell more than 3 jr chefs to re fill the bacon and it took them 20 mins. So yeah alot of negatives seemed to be observed by our group of friends who have just like me been patriots of this establishement. Rooms seemed to have changed very little. Some rooms seemed to be well stock with all the essentials some rooms seemed to lack a few things e.g bottle openers tea /cofee refills and glasses . However for a person visiting for the first time this perception can definitely differ . This was written with a lot of dissapointment and heart break hope the management will be able to revive this place before it becomes uncontrollable ( not that it is bad ) . Ps one thing that has never ever changed is the friendly staff so kudos for that. Love how pleasant everybody is ! C u soon as always :)

text: We stayed here for a few nights in August 2010 as part of a one month trip. I was very excited about staying here as it was designed by one of my favourite architects, Geoffrey Bawa. However, it was a little bit of a let down on a whole. On arrival the hotel is lovely. You drive through some large gates and up to the open reception area where you immediately notice the infinity pool which looks great. All the staff are very smiley but unfortunately the front desk staff don't really know what they are doing. There was a lot of commotion and we did not get checked in for an hour. Some of our friends did not get checked in for 2 hours. Not what you want after a long journey! First impressions of our room were ok. They are clean but nothing special. We were promised a spectular suite as we were there for a special occassion but we were just given a standard deluxe room which was disappointing. We eventually got our suite on our last night but the only difference was a bit more space and a bath so not really worth the extra money in my opinion. We spent a lot time around the infinity pool which is very clean and the pool boys are great. They provide water aerobics every morning and organise water volleyball straight after so it's a bit lively around that pool up unti lunchtime. There is another pool but we didn't use it. If you like your exercise there is also a small gym which is ok. It's small and basic but has the essentials. You can also go for a run along the beach but as with almost every beach in Sri Lanka be prepared to get hassled by the beach boys/women. One guy came for a run with me whilst trying to sell a tour which I thought was very amusing. Unfortunately I could not give him any business! The food here is great. There is a huge variety on offer and you won't be disappointed. However, if you order snack food be prepared to wait or for the staff to get your order wrong. This seemed to be the norm from our experience and speaking to other guests. The same goes for ordering drinks. They are super slow. You can quite often see your cold drink getting warm on the bar whilst the waiters have a chat. People were constantly chasing up the waiters or walking up to collect their own drinks. The staff, with a few exceptions, seemed to be the main problem at this hotel. They are all very friendly but even the simple things seemed to be an effort. Luckily we have a lot of patience so we found it funny but it was obvious some couples and groups there were getting very frustrated. We stayed at several other hotels in Sri Lanka and the staff were a lot more on the ball. Even when we checked out it became chaos. Lot's of confusion, incorrect bills and in one case it took nearly 1.5 hours! It was a group of 6 but still, not acceptable. We took 30mins and there was only 2 of us. To sum up, this hotel is nice. It has character but it is certainly not 5 star. The rooms and staff could be so much better. My plus points would be the infinty pool and the food. Everthing else could do with improvements. I would recommend this hotel but on the basis don't go there expecting the ultimate paradise. It's good but there is better in Sri Lanka. It's pretty good value for money but needs some attention. 7.5/10 overall.

text: This was our third time at the hotel. We were married on the beach when the hotel was the Triton, visited again on our 10th anniversary and have just returned from our third trip there. The hotel is as lovely as ever and makes for a really relaxing holiday in a beautiful setting. There are plenty of opportunities for excursions to see more of this fantastic country but it's also lovely to relax by the pools or wander along the stunning beach, especially at sunset. The staff throughout the hotel were excellent; from the reception staff at check-in, the restaurant staff, waiters, pool staff ... All were very helpful, friendly and gave a great service throughout our stay. We booked on an all inclusive basis and the food was always very good and plentiful. The staff also arranged a romantic 4-course meal on the beach for us which was superb. Would thoroughly recommend the hotel and we are already planning our next trip back there! Thanks to all the staff who helped make our holiday so enjoyable.

text: Just return from a week in Herritance Ahungala. The hotel is amazing with its infinity pool facing towards the ocean. Plenty of sunbeds, beautiful beach. Maybe the rooms needs to be renovated but that is no important, the most important are the people, with their heart on hands just to make your stay perfect. They are not a staff they are a heritance family and try to do everything that you become also a part of their family. Food prepared by Chef Manjula is just delishes. Beginning from European cuisine ending on real taste of Sri Lanka. Grilled lobster, crab curry, dhal, egg hooper are to die for. The food was the best I have been eaten in the all-inclusive hotel. Must say that in many good restaurant you will not eat better. Chef Manjula, who I have had chance to meet personally gave me is even his secret recipe for dhal. I have seen some negative comments about the rooms, food, cleaning- so if you look for a just the hotel (good drinks, animation, standard hotel food) do not go there but if you want to feel the soul of Sri Lanka is the place for you.

text: We were only here one night and arrived mid afternoon, so we were not able to get a very comprehensive view of the property. Check in procedure was very slow, albeit they do bring you a drink and snacks and invite you to sitâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.and sitâ€¦â€¦â€¦.â€¦..and sitâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦..and just when I was about to get up and enquire what was taking so long, they finally invited us to go to our room. There WERE a few people who arrived at once, but it really did take some considerable time, for reasons not clear to me Check out was also somewhat slow, and then getting summoned to an office behind reception makes you wonder what is going on NOW ? Has my card been declined, my visa an irregularity, am I wanted for something ? Turns out itâ€™s just the cashiers office ! So why not just accept payment at the front desk like every other hotel in the world ? Room was fairly large, comfortable, and of a good standard, with everything one expects from a resort hotel. I particularly liked the sliding shutters, as opposed to curtains. Cesar Ritz said about an hotel needing 3 things - â€œposition, position and positionâ€ and this property certainly has position ! Located right on the wide sandy clean beach, (not sure if one can swim from it) warm infinity pool reaching towards the sea. Palm trees, lawns, shady trees around the pool area â€“ itâ€™s the epitome of a beach resort hotel ! Itâ€™s a fairly large property too. The standard tourist trap shops selling souvenirs, but I suppose thatâ€™s to be expected ! The dinner buffet was of a good standard, and it was very pleasant to be seated in the warm night outside under the palms, on a lawn adjacent the beach, with lanterns for lighting â€“ all very Polynesian Island stuff ! Food was of a good standard, though I found the drinks service a little slow, and slow to follow up. Yes, they were busy with a lot of people, but I often have cause to question whether that is in fact an excuse or not ? In general itâ€™s often about having sufficient and well trained staff, and quite often just about general organization. On the one hand the hotel has everything you would expect of a luxury beach resort hotel, and there is nothing to complain about as such, but for me there was just something slightly missing - it was all TOO standard luxury beach resort, like many others I have stayed in, and no real â€œwowâ€ factor as such. I suppose itâ€™s difficult to be a â€œdifferentâ€ beach resort, and perhaps I just stay in too many hotels, but these beach resorts all tend to have the same formula and once one has stayed in a few, they all sort of blend together in your mind â€“ nothing truly memorable ! I had recurring thoughts of Monty Pythonâ€™s â€œPackage Tour Complaintâ€ skit â€“ go look it up if you arenâ€™t familiar with it ! We would actually like to go back some time and spend a bit longer, as lazing around the pool with a drink was just what we needed at the end of a busy 3 week trip to India and Sri Lanka. In the end though we had a pleasant stay, and no real issues, and I therefore recommend it as a good place to spend a few days and relax !

text: At the entrance to the hotel there was a big advertising board claiming to have the best culinary team in the island, since another tourist recommended the food here we booked in for lunch as a special treat. It was a buffet priced at over Â£27 per couple which is quite expensive compared to normal Sri Lankan standards, considering all the hype we were expecting a grand lunch to remember. We were tempted by the grilled seafood skewers as a starter and this was the beginning of the worst meal in Sri Lanka ever. We could not eat them they were stale and tough as old boots. I decided to go for the main course and on the way noticed to my horror the cause of the awful starters the chef was taking out old cooked seafood skewers from a container and putting them back on the hot grill. The main course did not impress one bit the meat curry was stale and very dry, the vegetables were overcooked. The desserts were awful and the only good thing served here was what they did not prepare themselves" the curd & honey". During our meal we requested to see the chef to make a complaint regarding this terrible food. Finally a gentleman appeared at our table who was unable to give us any satisfactory explanation. We ordered coffee and guess what it was stale and lukewarm. By then we were fuming and demanded to see the manager who was very apologetic and requested us to come back that evening for a meal on him, how kind. He even charged us in full for the worst meal we had in Sri Lanka. Do you think we went back that evening for another repeat performance on the house, "Hell no". Do not be fooled by false advertising claims when you can get a much better meal from any roadside cafe for less than Â£8 for two.

text: This is a lovely hotel in many ways but it isn't quite good enough to get a "very good". It seemed very expensive for what one got but that may be because we booked a suite directly with the hotel. I suspect many of the hotel guests had booked via tour operators and got a considerably better deal than we got. We were shocked by the average age of the guests which must have been 60+. Don't come here expecting a wild or exciting time! The setting is lovely and the beach is good. The waves are wonderful to play in but they are very strong and only for confident swimmers. The food was of a high quality and reasonably priced although breakfast was a little disappointing. Staff were well meaning but often inept. I once asked for bread 5 times before we got any. We could see the bread baskets in the restaurant ready to be given to diners but the waiters just didn't seem able to serve us (there was only one other table dining in the restaurant so the waiters were not rushed off their feet). We also asked for the bill only to be ignored for 15 minutes (despite being the only people in the restaurant by then). When we asked again, we were met with a blank look and a lack of comprehension. In the end, we said we were going to our room and asked if they could send the bill to us there? The bill never arrived although we were charged for the meal so someone managed to sort things out. At breakfast, we wanted to sit outside as the restaurant was very gloomy. There was only one umbrella between about 20 tables so we would sit in the shade which sometimes necessitated moving the table a little or turning it so we weren't in the sun. Quite often, the staff would then move the table back whilst we were serving ourselves at the buffet. We would then move it again. Also, I asked the chef making omelettes if I could have poached eggs and he had no idea what they were. Fortunately, another chef did and went and organised them for me in the kitchen (they were cooked perfectly). Having said all of that, the staff were lovely and wanted to please. The Valentine's dinner was great. It had the perfect level of cheesy entertainment (the dancers were hamming it up brilliantly), the food was very good and the staff couldn't do enough to please. The beds are very uncomfortable so do consider that if bed comfort is important to you. It was like sleeping on wooden boards. We had a good holiday here but it really wasn't worth what we paid.

text: Impressive hotel stay at Ahungalle Heritance hotel in Sri Lanka

text: We visited Heritance Ahungalla recently and observed some pros and cons that might be useful to point out. Pros. 1. As the room was booked as a part of our anniversary, we were given the most spacious room of the category and really loved every bit of it. It was cozy and relaxing. Our favorite part was how it seemed to be a sort of a separate building to the main hotel and opened up to the jacuzzi and resident green pool. 2. The hotel in general was very relaxing and spacious and never felt like it was crowded. well probably because it wasnt! but either way even if there was a heavy crowd it felt like you had your own space. Cons. 1. TV - Ofcourse you dont come on a holiday to watch TV BUT it would be great to have a few good options. The cable tv had very few channels excluding some of the most entertaining movie and tv show channels which I thought was a bit of a bummer. 2. The food was not great and not bad. Average I must say. We expected a large spread but it seemed that since it was off peak season and less crowd also because it was a weekday, there was very little variety and thereby "threw a dagger" to our expectations. Anyway Thanks Heritance for the nice stay and we hope to see you again sometime!

text: We stayed the night in a luxury room with a huge sitting/dining area and a separate king bedroom area. Lots of space for our little ones. Room was well appointed and amenities as listed on hotel website. Eventhough bathroom was good size, the raised up jacuzzi tub with an overhead shower was impratical. Literally need to climb in and out of the tub. We didn't experience the award winning cuisine from the buffet dinner. (Extremely salty grilled prawns, burnt BBQ meat. Poor food presentation). Breakfast was a tad better. Our benchmark was the dinner buffet at Heritance Kandalama. That's what we called award winning. We enjoyed the two pools and the wonderful beach right at the hotel doorstep. The service from the staff was excellent. Hotel ground was beautiful with a majestic view of the Indian Ocean especially from the lobby. Recommended if you get a good deal otherwise not worth paying the high price as this is 3.5 stars not luxury 5.

text: We stayed here in January / February 2023. The hotel its self is a beautiful building and was immaculately clean and well maintained. as far as I could tell all the rooms faced the beach with either a balcony or terrace. Our room 219 was clean and well equipped with everything you would expect from a hotel of this standard. There are two pools one is a quiet pool where ball games etc are not allowed the other is for fun and games, the pool attendants are friendly and and attentive. There is also a reasonably well equipped gym and a spa which is really well priced. We found the staff to be so friendly and nothing was too much trouble every request was met with a smile and service was efficient and prompt. The food was very good although if I had one suggestion it would be to remember that not everyone likes spice in their food, my wife is one who does not and on occasions found her choices very limited, but then there was always cake!! To conclude I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and should we decide to return to Sri Lanka (and I hope we do) we would certainly go back to Heritance.

text: We had 4 nights here at the end of a tour and it was by far the worst of the hotels we had stayed at. No problem with the room (though our friends managed to get their room booked out whilst they were in it!) but the service on two nights in the Coffee Shop and the Upper Dining was VERY slow. Added to this was the meat when it arrived after 90 minutes (!) in our meal at the Upper (Fine) Dining was overcooked in part and a lump of fat for the duck! This was very disappointing as we had been introduced to the company's head chef at a previous hotel. The Jade restaurant (buffet) was good both for dinner and breakfast though.

That's it for the good bits This hotel is on desperate need of an upgrade to claim its 5 star rating. 5 star this is not. If you are looking for a good 3.5 star hotel then this is fine but we have stayed in many other so called luxury hotels on this trip and they were all way above this hotel in terms of fit out and upkeep . They do many things really well here but 5 star lodgings it is not.

text: This hotel, fronting the beach on a large plot of land, is popular judging from the number of guests when I was there. Some guests had been there more than 20 times over the years. However, I was rather disappointed to see that the hotel is rather run down, unclean from the dust on the floor, some walls looked as if unpainted, the toiletries in the bath-room were just shampoo, bath gel and body lotion topped up in small ceramic bottles which I dislike as they donâ€™t appear to me to be hygienic. Further more, there were in-room slipper and thus makes walking in the room on unpleasant when wet after a shower. I said earlier, this is not a resort. Apart from the pool and restaurant, there were no other fun activities within the hotel for guests. But despite all these, I rather enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere surrounding the place and the friendly services of all staff. Our 3 nights stay there was thus an enjoyable one. As for location, there is no decent shopping nearby.

text: This hotel is positioned on a wonderful beach. While the hotel is starting to show its age the staff try very hard to look after the guests. The breakfast buffet is great to start the day and everyone should try the egg hopper! The beach is the real bonus of this hotel and the waves are great for body surfing. However, there is also one BIG downside. It would be great to be able to be enjoy the beach without the constant attention (unwanted!) of the touts trying to sell cheap and nasty products on the beach. It became so unwanted that we were forced to retreat to the privacy of the hotel, a not bad second option. Having spoken to the manager about touts it is clear that the hotel is trying to address the issue but is not there yet. I wish them success!

text: Our stay in this hotel was most enjoyable. All staff worked hard to make our holiday enjoyable. Our room was very comfortable with a sea view. The hotel, grounds and pools are well designed, particularly the main pool. The team of pool attendants are the most helpful I have ever encountered in any hotel in the world. I would certainly recommend this hotel however there is one issue I would suggest the hotel management team consider and that relates to noise from the pool activities and the lounge bar. The hotel has two pools - the one in front of reception is the one seen in all their promotional materials and is beautiful. However, it gets very noisy as a result of very loud music associated with activitites in the pool including aqua aerobics. This mirrors the experience of another reviewer jennymartyn. There is a second pool on the property which is not quite as stunningly beautiful but is still a nice pool. However, the noise from the main pool travels and that spoiled our enjoyment on a couple of occaisions. We prefer to listen to the sound of the waves on the beach and the noise of the birds in the trees not head-banging noise from aqua-aerobics and beach based activities. A big thank you to staff including reception staff (can't remember all their names), Vishme (guest relations), housekeeping and pool staff for trying so hard to meet our needs.

text: We have just returned from a 2 week (all inclusive) stay at the Heritance and had a great time. Our room was a bit tired but I believe is due to be refurbished, some rooms already having been renovated. The hotel is in a good position on a lovely beach â€“ great for a walk and it would take us just over an hour to walk to the far end and back. The sea is a bit rough for swimming in and the red flag was up for our entire stay, however it was good fun in the waves if you donâ€™t go out your depth. There are 2 decent sized swimming pools and we never had any problem getting a sunbed. Being all inclusive, all our meals were taken in the buffet restaurant. However there is an a la carte and a fish restaurant if you fancy a change, although you would have to pay for these and there is no discount. We found there was plenty of variety on the buffet and the food was of an excellent quality with authentic local dishes and of course a wide choice of different curries (green pea/cashew and beetroot/potato were some of our favourites). All the staff were very friendly and efficient. The chap that cleaned our room (319) was excellent and the bed was always beautifully decorated with flowers. Jananjaya in the restaurant was always there to top up our drinks. When you first arrive and walk on the beach or go out the front gate you will be approached by people looking to sell you trips/tuk tuk rides. Whilst it can get a bit annoying they are definitely better value than the tour operator excursions. We had a taxi to the fort at Galle for Â£30 between the two of us and the driver waited for us, whereas the tour company were charging Â£55 each for a half day trip to Galle. We also took tuk tuks to Brief garden by Bevis Bawa and the Lunuganga Estate of Geoffrey Bawa, and they were some of the highlights of our trip. There is an ATM about a 10 minute walk up the road. One thing to be aware of at the airport when you leave Sri Lanka is that you cannot take bottled water onto the plane, even if you have purchased it in the departure lounge. Oh and by the way there is a public holiday when there is a full moon and no alcohol can be sold anywhere and is not available at the hotel.

text: Our trip was in Dec which is a busy month. However when we called them in the morning to check if an early check in was possible they said 12pm would be fine. On our arrival we were made to sit in the lobby for 2 hours. We could have saved that time by coming later if it was not promised for 12 pm. When they finally gave us the room it was not cleaned well and we were told that the family before us had really messed it up and also stayed on way past check out time. Apart from this our stay was good. The room was big and spacious and the beds very comfortable. If the doors were left open a few mosquitoes would get in so its best to keep them shut when going to the pool or beach. The room service was ok. Best to stick to the rice as the burger we ordered was not very good. The fried rice was quite good. The staff are friendly and helpful. The chefs at the live stations in the morning (specially a lady) were very unenthusiastic about serving and overall the service was very poor. We expected more as it is after all a Heritance Hotel and should have 5 star service. The residents pool is the highlight. Its clean, big and quiet so we really enjoyed spending time at the pool. Hope the service improves.

text: I checked this hotel at tripadvisor before booking it and expected it to be nice and relaxing at the very least, however, the whole stay (we stayed there for 3 weeks) was a complete and utter disappointment! Looks like Heritance has changed a lot lately and it's surely not a 5* hotel anymore. After an almost 20-hour trip to the hotel, my only wish was to have a shower and lie down, however, we had to spent almost half an hour answering stupid questions about our anniversary, etc. The staff was too talkative and tactless even, several times we had spend almost the entire lunch in their company and nothing could possibly make them leave. All the advantages of this place faded away in comparison with its negative sides. Quite nice design of the room couldn't make up for holes in bedsheets, dirty curtains, breaking conditioning, old towels and other things. The food was really fabulous, however, when the evening food was under a set menu, almost all guest opted for the a la carte restaurant as the set menu was really poor and the meal lasted forever. The atmosphere was quite relaxing most of the time, however, there was no chance to even enter the pool as soon as weekend came and the hotel was fully packed with locals. Some things kept on spoiling our stay on every day basis. The beach area was constantly full of locals, who were trying to sell you a trip or whatever you wanted or didn't wanted. Even by the pool your every single movement was followed by their attempts to draw your attention. If you managed to escape and reach the ocean, several guys were waiting for you to come back. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone! For the first time in my life I was looking forward for going home!!

text: We have just returned from a most wonderful stay at this hotel, and can recommend it in every way. The situation, right on a beautiful beach, and the architecture blends perfectly in to the environment and makes the most of the cooling breezes. It is conveniently placed for visits to near by Galle, and we especially enjoyed cycling through the lanes of local villages. What makes this hotel stand out, though , is the staff. Although we only stayed for a week, they made us feel like members of the family, and we were totally at home there. Every member of staff went out of their way to anticipate and meet our needs, and it is almost impossible to single out particular individuals who made our stay so special. KK, the restaurant manager and his assistant Anushka, ensured we had all we needed for every meal, and even arranged a delicious picnic for us to enjoy on our trip home. The food was absolutely delicious, catering for every taste, and Praveen Fernando found us a shady table outside for breakfast every morning. Mr de Silva, the general manager, was always on hand, and we felt cosseted and cherished throughout our stay. The swimming pools are amazing, and the shady garden a delight to relax in. The rooms are comfortable and spotless , again, with wonderful service. The local people of Sri Lanka , offering such warm and genuine a hospitality, are what makes a visit to this country so very special, this can be experienced in full at the Heritance Hotel. We had the most wonderful holiday , and will be recommending it to family and friends. We can't wait to return. Many thanks to all the members of staff who contributed to our delightful stay.

text: Am avut upgrade de camera gratuit, obtinut prin booking, insa pentru ei asta insemna sa ne dea aceeai camera, doar ca la un etaj superior. Dupa ce am stat 3 ore in receptie am reusit sa obtinem camera conform rezervarii, insa nu are legatura cu pozele. Mucegai in camera. Pretul de 250 de dolari pe noapte este exagerat pentru o camera cu tavanul plin de mucegai. Mancarea nu este chiar buna. Peste pretul din meniu se va adauga: 10% servicii, 3% alte taxe si peste toate astea (pretul de baza + 10% + 3%) se adauga tva de 18% la toata suma. Hotelul este plin de rusi, ceea ce nu este placut pentru noi cei din lumea civilizata. Se trezesc de dimineata, isi pun prosoapele pe sezlong pentru a le rezerva si se duc inapoi la somn. Apar abia pe la 12, timp in care tu nu gasesti sezlong liber.

Valuables just speak from their heads. We went to Kandy with Kamal, Iâ€™ve attached the number. He even offered to buy it and fry it for free in a cafe from his friends.

text: Maybe our expectations were different, but we didnâ€™t get what we were hoping for with our three-day stgay at the Heritance Ahungalla. We thought that an all-inclusive resort would be a relaxing base of operations but found that we were pretty much sequestered on the property. We wanted to get out and about during the day or night and the operation and setting did not lend themselves to that â€“ the Heritance wants to capture all of your money during your visit. Rooms were clean and nicely appointed but small. High premiums for everything, from bottled water to laundry to room service to internet. Food options were limited and consistently underwhelming. Front desk and concierge staff were not particularly helpful when we did ask for suggestions for activities or dining off of the property. Should we find ourselves back on the coast in Sri Lanka we will look for a smaller hotel closer to one of the towns or villages, not an all-inclusive resort.

text: Was working in Sri Lanka and had the weekend to myself and managed to get a very good rate last minute for a very reasonable price (same as a HIE in uk) however full rate I think would be maybe not so worth it. Please note when I arrived they were doing quite a bit of rennovations (though this was being done discreetly and quietly to minimise effect to guests). However hotel was probably at least 50% empty. Hotel is a Geofrey Bawa Hotel (famous architect) and you can see his style throughout the hotel. Its not the usually glassy inpersonal type hotel that you can sometimes stay in - this hotel does have character for a large hotel. Though I think the hotel could do more to enhance this. Its quite a Large hotel with reasonable facilities. I went for a wander when I first arrived and everytime I turned a corner I seemed to find something new whether it was table tennis, to the table courts to a bars that are nicely spread out. Hotel itself is in lovely bay with some wonderful views. Overall I think it was a lovely stay however not quite as special as I thought it would be from hotel website. LOCATION Its roughtly 1.5 hours drive from Colombo, and probably a good 3 hours drive from airport. If you are suffering after a travelling you maybe want to do a stop over in Negombo near airport or Colombo city. Its slightly away from many of the overcrowded toursit areas like Bentota and this can have good and bad points. ARRIVAL When you arrive at the hotel - you are ushered to sit down and they bring over some refreshments whilst you sign in. It was nicely done - though I think if busy this may take some time, this si kind of usual for Sri lanka so be prepared for this and I take the time to wander a little or orders ome drinks. ROOM Room was well furnished and decorated - I had view of the back Pool and beach. Full AC and Fan. Please note room leads to an open plan corridor (very Geffrey Bawa - but this does mean at night you may get a few mosi's in your room when you open door or use the balacony so get them to spray your room before you go to bed and use the fan(mosi cant land on you if you have fan on) - I carry a can of baygon which you can buy in local shops to kill any mosi that may be hiding at night. Toilet was nicely done - though please note - no bath - which if you have children you may want to check on which rooms have baths. The toiletries were fine - but nothing to write home about - personally I prefer my own. Hairdryer in bathroom was good enough for ladies use. All seemed very clean and nice Wardrobe and draws, and space above draws doubles as suitcase stand. Beds were very comfortable, and sheets and towels all seemed fine and I had no complaints compared to other reviewers. Room had safe in wardrobe which seemed usual good hotel quality. There was a console desk for laptop and stuff. Kettle coffee/tea facilities. There was a very small mini frdge but it had no icebox which is a shame. Also please note alcohol apart from local beer is expensive - I would purchase what you need at duty free. Also in room large media cabinet - I am hoping they will look into flatscreens tv soon! Usual Sri Lankan Satellite available. I would have liked a DVD player. Also is small sofa and coffee table. Room had good lighting and I loved instaed of heavy curtains. they have light muslin nets curtain and then huge sliding panels which makes the room very dark and peaceful. The windows seemed to insulate reasonable well against outside although to be fair it was very quiet in any case. The balcony was usual standard - 2 seats and table. They gave free wifi FACILITIES Not bad for Sri Lankan hotel, but not quite up to a top western hotel. 2 very lovely pools, one with jacuzzi. tennis court (not sure whether in good state), table tennis, fitness room (nobody uses), pool/snooker tables (you pay for this about $1.5) 3 restaurants and quite a few bars, there is a games room and library however I never bothered to check this out. However no shops (its shutdown) jsut a jewerally shop. To get to anywhere you need to take a short drive. There is very lovely Spa with Indonesian ladies brought in specially - my advice - check this out - its lovely! FOOD I never bothered with restaurants - prefering to get room service. My first order a salad was so dissappointing - I had 1 lettuce leaf - I kid you not. However I peservered and everything else that came was lovely, and they even brought me cocktails and extra's to the room. However for half board price its probably better value to just eat the buffet on offer. I did do breakfast and was a good Sri Lankan buffet with plenty of variety from European, German, English, French to Sri Lankan curries. BEACH Beach is lovely - pretty clean when I went and is a very long bay. No packs of dogs and all very pretty. However annoying youths spoiled my walk by myself but the other locals when they heard were so horrified by rude behavious and apologised - which was very sweet. they even offered to accompany me at a distance so I could enjoy my walk without being bothered. SPA Well worth a visit on 1st day to help you get into holiday spirit of relaxation. Not Sri Lankan cheap but reasonable price by western prices. SERVICE It was quiet, however I thought service was very good. nicely balanced although I can see how some reviewers may get annoyed with the overfriendliness of some staff. Bless them they are on the whole very eager to make sure you enjoy yourself and you stay is good. I would rather have this than the rude obnoxious service you can get in the UK. Other points - Ground floor rooms - balcony is open to the grounds. Its perfectly safe - but with very young children this may be either a blessing or an issue. Also the ground floor rooms near the back swimming pool - may get noisy. If this is an issue I would mention it when you book or email hotel before your arrival. BOOKING OUT The bane of all Sri Lankan Hotels and this one is no exception - allow 20 mins at least to book out if its not busy and a lot longer if it is busy. I would suggest get them to organise bill whilst you finish packing up or having breakfast. OVERALL A really lovely hotel but perhaps not quite up to the image suggested on the glossy website (but maybe after rennovations??). However I actually preferred this to the Lighthouse near galle (another Geofrey Bawa hotel) due to service and has a certain something to it. Location is lovely and tranquil when I visited. Would I go back - most definately however 3-4 days would be my limit. Just not enough there yet.

text: We came to this hotel for a couple of days of rest and sun at the end of a two week tour of Sri Lanka. I have to admit it was my least favourite hotel. Yes there was lots of opportunity for sunbathing around the pool. The men were very attentive with keeping the grounds immaculate and bringing mattresses and towels. Also the bars were located around the grounds so drink was easy to obtain. But despite this being a hotel designed to blend with nature, I found the stark long corridors austere and unfriendly, and very noisy. In fact they echoed any noise particularly in the early mornings. In the restaurant there were far fewer waiters than previously and those that were in attendance were much less attentive. And the entertainment was a mixed bag. We saw a delightful cultural show followed by a very amateurish fire show. Positives? Lovely large rooms. The quietest air con ever. Great range of food. Lovely location on a pristine beach.

text: Well having had a long flight and a long drive I may have been slightly over tired but my first impressions of the hotel and the room was disappointment. It does come down to taste but I found the hotel is characterless. Our room was good but without the two extra beds for the children which was irritating as my husband had emailed the hotel directly confirming them but they were set up quickly and our request for table lamps in the lounge rather than overhead lighting met as quickly. The children loved the pools and I absolutely hated breakfast! It was enough to bring tears to your eyes the oppressive dining room the scrum around the breakfast bar seemingly at all times, the awful service. I had so many variations on getting a cup of earl grey they were green tea, warm milk, teabags and nothing else including water or a cup, they ran out of tea bags I supplied my own and then tea arriving 30 minutes later when you're just about to leave. In the land of bountiful fruit why are 3 out of 5 breakfast juices made from concentrate or nearer to cordial? Can they not default to 4 place servings, then if 2 come to breakfast they are happy and if 4 come down they are instantly satisified a win win rather than waiting 10 minutes for cutlery for 2 of the party. Can they not allocate a server to families staying longer than 3 nights thus establishing a rapport. Saying that the service elsewhere was fine. The food ranged from adequate to good. Amal's in Bentota was excellent for sea food and Refresh in Hikkaduwa(45 mins) had an enormous choice and was very good. The location was ok , Galle was an hour drive Bentota about 30 minutes. We did take some trips to Udawlawe 4 hours each way and Sinharaja 3 hours each way. As mentioned in previous reviews the beach is effectively out of bounds if you do not wish to be pursued by the local tour guides and hawkers. It could be a great hotel with adequate staff training to instill a sense of ownership and pride, a rethink of the decor, a complete overhaul of the main dining room practices, some investment in soft furnishings. Despite its short comings we thought the Heritance was good value for money.

text: we chose this hotel for 5 days rest on our arrival in Sri Lanka. Whilst the hotel itself is lovely and our room was fantastic - clean, large, great balcony, lovely big clean bathroom - we were disappointed by the aggressive sales tactics of the staff every time we were in the main hotel area. We were constanly being asked if we wanted to try the spa, the fine dining restaurant or the outrageously expensive barbecue on the beach. We found the hotel bar and restaurant to be very over priced as well. This is definitely more of a family hotel so those without children may consider other options. There is a limited amount to do outside the hotel so may be better for people on an all inclusive or at least half board package. We did appreciate the hotel's facilities - two lovely clean pools, tennis courts, table tennis all available but the beach isn't really very usable due to the number of salesmen on it (not the hote's fault).

text: The service was exceptional in this hotel - hence I am starting off by mentioning this - everyone was so friendly and went out of their way to be welcoming. I thought dinner was average but nevertheless enjoyable; breakfast was lovely. It is more of a family hotel/ older couple hotel and I think the entertainment is geared to that audience. For the price this hotel is amazing. Another thing worth mentioning is this hotel seems to do a lot for its local community which I think is fantastic - there was an ad for a charity it supports in the lift. I also did wonder if the hotel endorsed the beach sellers - some people probably find the beach sellers a bit annoying but actually if you just tell them you are not interested they leave you alone. These people are just making a living and if I can help them by buying from them I am happy to do so.

text: We had the opportunity to stay for one night. The pool and beach were truly exceptional, providing a delightful experience. The variety offered in all three meals was impressive, with a wide range of flavors that were quite enjoyable. However, I must express my disappointment with the accommodations. The room we were assigned felt quite dated, and the beds were not particularly comfortable. Additionally, the air conditioning unit's controller was malfunctioning, which affected our comfort. The bathroom was notably small, particularly the shower cubicle, making it inconvenient for a comfortable bathing experience. It's worth mentioning that the absence of a hand shower in the bathroom was a drawback. Regrettably, we also found that the staff did not display the same level of friendliness towards locals. Considering our experience, I would suggest this establishment for a day outing rather than an overnight stay.

text: We recently stayed at the Heritance and I can say that it was an absolute delight. From the moment you arrive it takes your breath away -- the drive up to the front of the hotel brings you to the view through the lobby, out over the pool and to the see beyond. The hotel's refurbishment has been sumptuous -- beautiful furniture, stylish decor and very well appointed rooms. The food was excellent. Every day we'd see the restaurant manager who would talk to us by the pool and tell us what the specials were going to be that evening, and on the one occasion we went to the fine dining restaurant we had the most exquisite food. We were brought two extra complimentary courses and had wonderfully attentive service (although I have to say that a very minor downside here was that I don't think the staff realised that the CD they had put on was a Christmas CD, which wasn't too appropriate in late January, but never mind...) It was rather heartbreaking that there were so few tourists around in such a beautiful hotel.

text: I was attending a wedding held on 20th December 2014 and a friend of mine and I had decided to stay at Heritance. Coming from the UK I was keen to stay close to the wedding venue and enjoy the supposed five star luxury that this hotel boasted to offer. My friend a resident of Sri Lanka arranged the accommodation some five months in advance for us to stay from 19 Dec till 21 Dec, using Booking.com. However upon arrival, they didn't have our booking for 19 only 20. Some 45 minutes, emails and phone calls later I was given a room based on half board. The room itself was large and nice. A bit dark in decor but view of sea front was nice. The hotel is large however there is no clear indication of how the rooms are numbered on each floor. There is according to the member of staff showing me to my room a north and South wing again this is not indicated visibly so it's easy to get lost. The entrance of the hotel is stunning however the rest of the hotels falls in comparison. For four hours I was without WIFI, a number of phone calls later a staff member turns up and fiddles with my phone including switching my phone off airplane mode connecting me to my UK service provider and leaving me with a Â£40.00 data roaming fee whilst still not realising that the Wifi was an issue with the hotel and not my phone. After trying to relocate me to a new room much smaller with a terrible view I eventually head in hands and eyes filled with tears of frustration and tiredness, was placed in a more pleasant room with a bigger balcony that over looked the sea and the wedding venue. The sliding door which acts as a blackout was unable to fully close because the side table was too big. I had to move this in order for the blackout to fully close. The air conditioner controls were broken in all three rooms so I had to use my nails to switch off the air conditioner. The shower cubicle was placed in such a away that you had to get in close the door before turning shower on. The hotel toiletries were poor - the shower gel and shampoo were all placed in bottles that were not sealed and the soap was well rather useless. There were also no small hand towels or towels big enough to dry hair with. All in all two large bath towels and two hand towels. No bath robes either to sit and relax in. A basic I feel for a hotel claiming to be five star. The mini bar of the last room was broken and had never been checked so we found the drinks warm mouldy and in drinkable. The cost of a glass of wine in comparison to the bottle found in the mini bar also made no sense. It was cheaper in the mini bar. The dining room (only one restaurant in this hotel) was dark and dismal. The hot food area was hard to find until further inspection. The food was ok. A very basic selection. Nothing fancy or elaborate. The bar area outside by entrance was far more prettier yet the service was poor. Morning breakfast in the same dining room was a very dark and gloomy affair. The decor and seating was so basic and dark that you just didn't want to eat in there. The only blessing was the guest relations officer Shanika who was so lovely and ever so eager to ensure we were happy that she went out of her way to do everything to make us feel at ease. We were on exit served with a $200.00 a night bill which I had to question over and over again. I am really sad to say that it was really shocked and disappointed by everything I had witnessed at this "luxury" hotel and having had a thorough read of what is expected to meet the international standards of a five star hotel - this to me is just a glorified bed and breakfast. Having experienced five star luxury and also other ratings of hotels I think I have had better staying in a cheap bed and breakfast in Brighton for far less the price tag. I can't say I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would recommend those that work hard for their money go look elsewhere.

text: From most of the reviews here and because of the generally good reputation of Heritance hotels we had high expectations for our stay here. This was the last part of our Sri Lankan trip before returning to Colombo and the plan was to relax and enjoy a luxury hotel along a beautiful beach. The beach was beautiful but the hotel was disappointing. Pros: -Beautiful beach-clean, not crowded. -Decently appointed room with large balcony. -Wifi that worked well. -Lovely reception area and infinity pool. Cons: -Room floor was sandy, bathroom mats with dirt smudges. -Bad housekeeping service. After being out all morning our room still wasn't cleaned - I called and asked to have it done right away while we were at lunch. They finally arrived while we were napping three hours later. -Broken minibar never repaired or replaced, after we requested -Breakfast buffet restaurant -Very strong moldy/mildewy smell permeates. Buffet adequate but not great. Chaotic atmosphere and spotty-to-bad service. -Hall noise (many children in hotel during our stay) -Noise from pool area - music at night, exercise activity in pool mid-morning Altogether there were too many things wrong with this stay. Disappointing for what is touted as a five star hotel. We would not return or recommend.

text: This is absolutely not a 5 star resort - not by international or Sri Lankan standards. Everything from the small room to the aged gym and very basic amenities was a disappointment. The food is admittedly excellent but the restaurant staff have absolutely no sense of how to host more than 100 people. On the whole, the staff are friendly but typically clueless. Basic hotel processes such as charging drinks to a room or booking a spa appointment have proved very trying. Their cashier desk is simply a joke - patrons have to go to a little room in the back of reception to make small payments, as if they are in some bizarre 1950s public administration building. The overall impression is in fact an insult to guests who are paying a significant premium for their stay.

text: Now, we have been coming back to this Hotel since it was called Triton because it stood out among typical beach hotels in Sri Lanka and coming here once in a while was treat for our children. It is a quite different now, and not particularly in a good manner. Our last stay at the hotel was on a weekday and was out of season. The property was about half full and a renovation was going on in the main side. At the dining hall, for some odd reason, there were no cloth table napkins and instead, a cheap replacement of paper serviettes. The food served were all so bland and nothing impressive, that's including desserts. I even overheard a couple saying that it was the same for the past few days! Breakfast had in store for us, an averagely spicy Sri Lankan food corner which was quite good. Pools and activity around the pool was enjoyable and the best part of this stay. An interesting underwater Zumba class also took place! The rooms were the same as before, thank goodness, but one thing made me stop my praise. The bidet shower was out of order. There was a surprise at the check out. I made reservation by calling this hotel and made sure that child meal charge was included with the price. (Child stays free in a double room sharing bed but for the meal, they charge about 30USD). In any case, we were asked to pay extra for the child meal because the price mentioned was the Double room rate. It was a mistake done by booking operator and the Hotel said that if we refuse to pay, the balance will have to be deducted from operator's wage. Since we did not want that to happen, we just paid and left. Overall, I think the hotel could have done a little more to repeating guests. I think that the hotel might have gotten complacent, due to the five star rankings people have given them, but as of now we lost loyalty to this hotel and unlikely to recommend others to stay.
